review: Really bad service.  We even asked for the manager to help us out but he made it worse.  I will never come her again.   I guess you should come here if you want bad service, poor management and 2,000 calories.
BBQ and Caesar wrap plus a TNT!  Now u got dinner*
The server was really nice. She was fast friendly and helpful. Every time I have gone its always excellent service.
This Red Robin above average. Yes, its in the mall but they are great with kids and alway have a ballon for my son. Keep up the great work. 3/4 because its in the mall.

We go here mostly for Birthday celebrations because of the free Birthday Burger promotions.  The food is always good and the service is right on.  They do have a tendancy to forget about you if you sit at either patio area but it really depends on the server.  The last time we ate here was for my son's birthday.  The server, Lauren, was great.  He made sure that everything was attended to and all of our needs met.  They should clone this guy.  We have had other servers at this location just as good and a few that were more into goofing off but over all it equals out.  Like any other place we have eaten, there are good days and bad days, this location has way more good ones.

Good location. You can eat after a long day at the mall. I suggest their freckled lemonade. As for the main entree, I like getting the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Warp. It's VERY good and my most favorite. Love that the fries are bottomless too. Def will come back if I get hungry while at the mall again!
Love this place. Been here about 6 times and every time the food is great and the services is A+. Love coming here for lunch and the $6.99 burger and unlimited fries.

Good burgers and service. A little noisy here when it's full. Dude do you need to bring your screeching baby in here like at 10:00 PM. They should be asleep! I don't blame the kid. I blame the idiot parents. Get a baby sitter. I had a free entree or burger (Red Royalty Card) because it was my birthday month. I got the riblets and mac & cheese and coleslaw. Riblets were nice and zesty, the mac & chesse was nice and cheesy and the coleslaw was average.  Service was decent but the place is really noisy.

The fried zucchini is the best fried zucchini  I've evert tasted. The staff here is outstanding! Service at its finest! Also don't forget the onion ring tower! D'lish. this is a family restaurant, it gets noisy. If you want a quiet night out and are on a date...find a place with $50 a plate.

Service was good, the waitress was friendly and attentive the burger though..really all the hype, the commercials but it was I swear to god a frozen fricken burger on a stale bun. I was not impressed at all. The bottomless steak fries were good, the red robin seasoning on the table is heavy on the oregano and cumin and good on the fries but not wirth the hype at all.

VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THE SERVICE. My wife and I decided to try this place for the first time yesterday and I must admit that the food is excellent. But when I needed a refill on my drink my frustration started. I placed my EMPTY glass at the edge of the table so the servers could easily notice. Several of them passed by but no one stopped by. After about 10 minutes, the food is getting cold and I couldn't continue eating without my drink. Our server finally passed by our table but was not planning to stop by so I HAVE to stopped him and asked for a refill. He asked what kind of drink I was drinking and I said regular coke.  When he left our table I thought he was going to get my drink but instead he went to next table to take their orders and I waited again for another 5 minutes but HE NEVER CAME BACK. We thought about leaving without finishing the food but finally was able to get someone else attention (not sure if he was a server because he was wearing light blue shirt and everyone else is wearing black shirt) and within 30 seconds I FINALLY GOT MY DRINK. And a few seconds after I got my drink our server quickly gave us the bill. Thanks.
Slow service at first but once she came and took our order she was awesome. Even told her we were gonna split something and she brought it split. :)

Came in with a friend after doing some shopping at NCF. At first it felt like we had been forgotten. Then our waitress came by Kelly, she was amazing. My coke tasted like diet and I asked her to change it which she did. Then the 2nd one tasted awful too. She offered to get me something else and was honestly nice about it. =) We ordered an app and the clucks and fries but we forgot to tell her we wanted it split, she split it anyway with out us asking =D Everything else was standard but Kelly was AWESOME.

great service, love the new whiskey creek salad as well as the south western salad.  eat there often. since i own aria bridal in the mall i eat there often, a little to noisy is why i discounted a star

This place rocks hands down. Great prices for kids. It's less than $5 for the kids when endless fries and pasta with a drink. Burgers are all under $10. I just love this place. Now... about this location. Not the best. Lots of traffic and the service has been slow many times that I come here. This is the closest Red Robin to me otherwise I would be going to another one. Just wish the service was better.

Usually this location is great but my last visit was a disappointment.  My granddaughter ordered a pepperoni pizza and they made it without.  They offered to bring some to throw on it but I wasn't gonna accept that idea.  The manager came and said he'd make her a new one.  I also ordered my favorite salad the Southwestern w the dressing on the side and it came already mixed so the manager came over and said he'd make another one.  Think the kitchen help was either overwhelmed or new but I was disappointed with the delay but the food was good.

RED ROBIN YUMMM! Based on our experience the night I went, I give it a 5. It had been a while since we had visited Red Robin and I missed the fries. I decided to get something different this visit. I usually get the Clucks and Fries so I went for the BBQ chicken wrap. Wish I had stuck with the Clucks. Not that the wrap wasn't good or anything. There's just something about fried food that makes things so much better. My fiance had the "Whiskey BBQ" burger which he talked about for days. "I haven't had a great tasting burger in a VERY long time" he said. His son had a bacon burger which he also loved. Matt was our server that night. He was great. He greeted us in a timely manner, he checked on us accordingly and refilled our drinks without having to ask. He even gave me a to go cup for my iced tea. I really am that obvious that I'm an ice tea addict. We really enjoyed our dinning experience. We look forward to our next visit!

You know what, you really can't beat this place.  The burgers are good, the fries are bottomless and the service - well, we've been in twice in the past couple of weeks and have heavy-tipped Lauren who's provided FANTASTIC service both times. Makes for a consistently good experience.  Cheap, good food; great fast service.

The food is average, but my experience last night was incredibly below average.  My wife and I called ahead to put our name in at 6:30.  They took our reservation and when we got there we were seated immediately, which was great considering that the last few times we went there the wait can be extreme. So for us to be seated immediately was terrific, however we were ignored for 10 minutes.  No drink order... however our waitress did toss our place settings in the middle of the table.  That was the acknowledgment that we were there.  Finally, our food and drink order was taken, however it took another 5 minutes to get the drinks to our table.  When the food came, it was average at best.  The biggest disappointment of the night was that our Red Royalty card was declined because I have opted-out of receiving Red Robin's incessant emails.  The bummer of this was that I recalled that I had accumulated enough points to "earn" a free burger.  Red Robin's "Royalty" card requirement has resulted in me requiring to lose my "Loyalty" to Red Robin.  Goodbye.  We're done.

Busy day at the mall, but we got right in and seated at a clean table. The place was hoppin'. Happy, friendly waitstaff and plenty of them.  Food was served hot, timely, and delicious! Drink and food menus were outstanding.  Atmosphere was fun and we'll be back.

So, I usually love red robin and would give them a higher rating. Their burgers are great and who can beat bottomless fries?? Yet, I had a bad experience there last night. My father and I showed up and the host sat us, yet we made it clear that we did not want a table and did not want to be by the door. What did he do? He offered us a table by the door, then showed us a booth by the door.When we told him yet again what he wanted he got really defensive and was like "well this is just where I picked but I guess you can sit where you want. " Then our waitress was not the best, she was nice though, yet she barely came over to check on us. Half way through the meal she dropped the check on us, which was strange and made us feel a little bit rushed. Once we were ready to go, we were looking around for our waitress and found her sitting with three other people eating. She proceeds to walk over to our table with her mouth full and tell us how hungry she was and she was starving because she had to work later than expected. EW, first of all and more importantly, she should have washed her hands. Then she handed us two to-go containers with her nasty fingers that she was just stuffing her face with. I got up and got two other clean to go containers and asked for a manager. The manager was one of he people she was eating with and showed no concern at all for the waitress violating the " workers must wash their hands before and after returning to work" rule. All he said was, "I will talk to her about that." Nothing more, nothing less. I even let him know that I work in a restaurant as a waitress and that is just unacceptable because people can get sick if one is not washing their hands regularly. Still, not much concern from the manager. I am not sure if I will return back which is unfortunate because i have been dining there  for years, bummer:(

I was craving a nice fatty burger tonight, so I decided to visit an old favorite. It had been over 5 months since I was last here and I couldn't remember why. Well the night started off well with a really sweet waitress, she was energetic when it came to conversing, BUT her waiting skills were awful, honestly the entire staff was just plain terrible. My burger came to me cold, my garlic fries had no garlic, it took ages to get a refill on both my beverage and fries. Maybe I need to stay away for 10 months instead of 5
for a burger joint this place is pretty sweet. Loved "sand in my shorts" and their fries yummm

My husband loves this place for their chicken parmesan, fries & freckled lemonade. me being a veggie, i have to sayTheir veggie burgers are very good! I always get their teriyaki one. So good! You'll love their tasty burgers, endless fries & strawberry lemonade refills!

Always enjoy coming here after shopping. Very convenient and not very long wait times. I have tried various burgers at Red Robin, but I prefer the chicken burgers over the beef. I've been here so many times that I have tried all of the chicken burgers and my favorite would have to be the whiskey river bbq chicken sandwich (lots of calories though), for a healthier option the simply grilled chicken sandwich is pretty good as well. No plain rubbery chicken. I love fries, so it's a plus we get all the fries we can eat here!  I would also recommend the Irish Beer Shake!! It was yummy.

Meh. I'm not sure if my wavering opinion about Red Robin concerns my changing tastes or their changing food and service. I used to LOVE their burgers - however, I was pretty underwhelmed with my most recent experience here. I came with my boyfriend for lunch on a weekday, and it was super packed but we got seated right away in the bar. Our server was decent - not bad but not overly friendly/attentive either. And that basically summed up the rest of our visit: good enough, but not outstanding. We both had their spiciest burger and fries, which we found to be tasty but overly greasy. It was just kind of a juicy mess :P Nothing came super hot either, and the fries were waaaay overseasoned. I love that Red Robin seasoning, but not enough to eat something covered in it! It's crazy salty when it's not used in moderation! If you love it here, no problem. But if you think their burgers and fries are missing a little something and you want to try something else in North County, I'd recommend Sublime Ale House or Churchill's Pub in San Marcos or the Flying Pig in Oceanside. These spots (and a few others out of the area) have spoiled me burger-wise, sorry Red Robin!

i am not a fan of RR...but apparently it is the ultimate place for kids.  When they took RR out of Del Mar Highlands ...i was sure we would never set foot in one again...ever..but we returned. disclaimer...i dont hate RR...i just don't think they make a good burger and that is what they are known for...the burgers are ok...but there are so many better places to get a good burger.   what is good here, are the salads.  never ever regret ordering a salad...they are quite yummy and worth the price.  but every once in a while..i go for a burger...and regret it.   my son orders pepp pizza 100% of the time and loves it daughter order mac n cheese 100% of the time and loves it  this location...packed! weekends in the mall are fun and crazy (we were here for a build a bear party. service was fine...i mean...i am not sure who my server was b/c i had probably 5 different people come help us...but when i needed something there was no one to be found.  I get that this is not a 5 star place with servers hovering in the corner waiting to top off your water after you take a sip....but the service was quite lame.  but i'm sure it is up to par with this level of establishment.  so i really don't have anything bad to say...this is just an average restaurant with average service and average food...it fills your belly and makes the kids extra happy.. FYI...my kids asked me to give it a 5 star rating...for what it's worth

This was my first visit to Red Robin and the only reason it is even getting two stars is because I really liked my burger.  The service was horrible.  We would have had a better chance of world peace than getting drink refills.  We only saw the server like 3 times during the whole meal; he took our order, stopped by right when food was brought out by other servers and then when he dropped the bill.  He had 4 other servers bringing things to our table for us (drinks, sauce, napkins) and even then we had to wait forever for stuff.  Several of our food orders came out wrong and had to be sent back.  When my boyfriend finally got his food made correctly it was still waaay overcooked, but he was to hungry at that point to do anything about it.  The sides of broccoli are horrible too; under-cooked and I only got 4 florets total.  I'm not sure how that is supposed to replace the like 20 fries that all my friends got with their meals.  Once again I didn't bother saying anything to anyone about the broccoli; not that I could have since our sever didn't show up again until he dropped the bill and by then we had all thrown in the towel. Now I wont say that I'll never go back.  Everyone has an off night and as a server I know what it is like to be busy and have to serve larger parties.  But this was by far one of the poorest service efforts I've ever seen.

Ok, so I usually don't write reviews but i had to because we had a WONDERFUL experience there tonight. We dine at Red Robin about once every month. The server we had tonight, Aaron, was phenomenal! He always made sure our drinks were full and was very attentive about everything else. When my husband picked a few tomatoes out of his food, he ran over and asked if my hubby requested no tomatoes. He didnt, they just loaded them on the food tonight. So all in all, it was great and he is the best server we ever had there. Not pushy at all, we could finish our meal comfortably without feeling rushed. When we go back, I hope Aaron is working!!

Katie is the best!!! We had our nieces birthday there and she took care of our big party no problem. When you have a big party you feel bad to ask for a few extra things because it is a lot of work but she was on it. Great waitress :)

The service was great at this location. The burgers have always needed a little seasoning for my taste buds . They do have red robin seasoning at the table, but they should add some to the beef. The bottomless steak fries yummy and they were prompt about bringing them when we ordered more. Food is good and inexpensive ;-)
Really good food but it can get a little loud at times.  The service is always accommodating and helpful.  Just ask and they can get it for you.
Unlimited fries and a burger with an egg on it. I'm a fan. Guiness shake was killer, Blue Moon not so much. Staff is normally pretty good.
The place is a decent place to eat. It gets 3 stars because the food is alright.

I ALWAYS get one here. The crispy chicken sandwhich (without pickle). And it is invariably delicious. But as others have mentioned  the service is pretty lousy. I was here with a friend and her little one the other day fairly early. Around 11. It wasn't busy and there wasn't really any excuse for it to take as long as it did.  But honestly that sandwhich is so freaking good I will be coming back.

I love their burgers and their endless fries! The first round of fries used to be bigger, but now they give like 10 fries with your burger. Saves the restaurant money I'm sure, but also makes the server have to go back and forth more haha. Do not forget their special seasoning on your fries! So delicious!!

This is a great burger restaurant, I like the ambience, the family atmosphere the specialty burgers are tasty, be sure to try the strawberry lemonade and it's great that they have endless steak fries!  A special note,  the fish and chips is very good, I enjoy this off the menu as well, the fish is lightly battered and does not eat heavy.  I have read other complaints on Yelp about the service being slow, but I have not experienced this the last few times I've been here.  For a family burger night out I love Red  Robin.

What can I say..... This place has gone way downhill from about 4 yrs ago.  The last couple of experiences have been  a doozy.  My wife's burger came out wrong.  So her burger was sent back and took quite some time to get it right.  My daughter's Mac  N Cheese didn't come out until my wife's burger came back.  I'm halfway through with my burger and the waitress asks if I need another refill when my drink is completely empty.  The service was lousy.  The only thing they got right was the manager came out and removed my wife's meal off the bill.

Edit: they've changed the whole menu, and have gotten more expensive. The burgers are smaller and the ingredients have changed. Avoid. Previous review: Go there and order only one thing: the Whiskey River BBQ Burger. Delicious tangy sauce that's not too sweet, crunchy fried onions, mayo, good quality beef and all the fixin's make this the go-to burger. Sure, you can order something else, but you'll be sorry. Enjoy. The fries are decent - even better if you order them well done (crispy).
I hate the food but I love it, the place sucks but it's amazing. I wanna go again but I don't. Love it, hate it.

Red robin is definitely not a 5 star restaurant. But gosh is it delicious and on point every single time. I love their fries so much!! Sometimes you may go on a busy night and find you aren't getting as much attention from your waiter or waitress. But my waiter last trip.. Matt B.. Was beyond amazing!!! I was surprised! I was very happy and left him a big tip and also reviewed him so that his manager would see how great he was doing :) we need better customer service in Southern California.

Been there 10+ times and I have to give them some credit.  Almost always a line outside on the weekends but when they say 15 minutes, it's usually 10.  No matter how crowded the food comes quickly, and when you have a 3 year old with you, that's a bonus.  I like the steak fries and spicy burger with jalapenos "chips" or whatever they call them.   Never had my glass run empty either.  No, it's not gourmet, quiet, romantic or French cuisine, but they do family food in a kid friendly environ the way it should be done.

Hi, We went there after shopping at the mall...we were tired and we had a 2 month old baby with us...We just wanted to enjoy a meal as we were hungry.... BUT Our server was horrible...her name was "KIM" We are vegeterian...so we asked this server about the details in burger.... She was soo rude in explaining the stuff...her voice was loud...she was acting as if she was doing us any favor... CRAZYY EXPERIENCE....BEWARE of this crazy server...

Food amazing! Service was a bust though. 9 out of 10 times this restaurant has outstanding service but this last visit completely changed my perspective on this location's red robin. Our server "Melanie" thoroughly ruined my experience. Beware this server.

I have been to several Red Robin locations before. General Feedback: The burgers are greasy, but not too much so. They're pretty good.  The used to have a Santa Fe burger I really liked, but that is long gone. The main highlight is an endless supply of steak fries.  These are delicious and the seasoning the put on it is really tasty.  I think they taste better with Ranch, but that is a personal preference.  The poppy mustard dressing is worthless, don't bother. As for this location, everything was fine until the check came.  I felt really rushed to pay my bill and I thought it was incredibly rude.  I know I will go again, the food is good enough to deal with it.
We drive from San Diego to Escondido at least once a week for the great food. Ask for Clarissa. She's one of the fastest & efficient waitresses.

My family has always loved this Red Robin, and we visit it for every birthday.  My youngest son had a birthday while we were evacuated due to fire, so when we got back into our home I whisked him by myself over to Red Robin so he would have some kind of a birthday celebration. After eating a server brought a sundae shoving it at him and no birthday song.  Well, I complained and they made it right.  So today again we go there for a birthday, all four of us, and there was no birthday song nor sundae.  So, I am disappointed in them today.  The food was good as always but want to mention waitress "KIM".  She was a perfect robot waitress: Attentive, thorough, but without any pizzazz.  She got us everything and checked on us all the time.  However I was watching her and she was picking up dirty dishes and wiping her jeans/not apron.  Then standing waiting to get our orders when, when...when...for some unknown reason grabbed the tops of our burgers and sandwiches and lifted all our buns up and looked at our sandwiches under the hot lights.  Ummmm....how gross!  I just don't get it.  Complained online.  Don't want her anymore.  No birthday song, no sundae, no memory to keep, and gross fingers touching my food!
I was there yesterday and had the best service ever by Maile. She was so nice and attentive I was so very impressed. The food was very good too, but the customer service was better.
Great fries! Great atmosphere! Great shakes! Great service! Everything is all around great. If you go here and you don't leave happy, something's wrong.

Pretty good food and drinks and great service, but the restaurant smelled like rotten eggs!!! We asked our server what it was and she said they think it's in the vents. Nobody wants to eat in a place that reeks. We moved to the bar and it was better, but I am only giving 2 stars because they should get that fixed or not seat people where it stinks.

We are regulars and keep coming back for the amazing food and service.  The manager Greg is the best and makes you feel like family. Some other great servers to mention Caroline, Melanie, and Derrick just to name a few. I'm addicted to the Pretzel Bites, crispy chicken sandwich and salad.  Seriously though I've yet to have anything I don't like.  It's a major plus that my kiddo is made to feel like a rock star every time we have dinner here!!

This my first time ever making a yelp. I was very uneasy about my experience today at lunch that I feel the need to express it. I went to Red Robin with a friend around 1:45-2:45 today for lunch. We were sat at a high top bar table and were told Veronica was going to take care of us. When Veronica finally came to our table she right from the start had a rude approach of greeting us. The host sat us in the bar area because we are of age and the location was busy. She took our order and from that moment on Veronica never helped us even though she was our assigned "server." We both needed a refill on our drinks & I had to grab another server to do it. This servers name was Nick & he was very helpful the entire visit. Another server brought our food to us. Veronica never asked us how the meal was or if we needed anything ever during our lunch visit. Yet again we needed a refill on our drinks & Nick once again grabbed the refill for us & was very kind & helpful. We were about done & another guy Joe pre bused the area for us & brought my friend a box for her leftover wrap. He also made my Freckled Lemonade in a TOGO cup for me to take. We sat for a while & Joe came by and asked us if we needed anything I then told him we needed a check to pay. Joe brought me the check & also wrote my phone # on the check so I could get my reward points. We put the check presenter on the edge of our table with the credit cards sticking out to pay the bill. Still no Veronica to take our payment or help us in anway/shape or form. Veronica had an empty bar with no guests & there really was no excuse why she couldn't "serve" our table. My friend I was with brought the check up to Joe at the bar & he cashed us out. I have been in the service industry for 11 years & a fellow bartender myself and this lack of service was terrible. Before we left I made sure to hand my tip to the nice gentlemen Nick who took care of us. My friend who is not in the service industry left her tip for Veronica even though she never helped us. I take care of servers when I go out. Being in this industry customer service is HUGE!! When we left she was doing side work for the bar  like stocking juices & fruit. Your guests should always come first no matter what. She never said goodbye or thanks for coming in nor did anyone else. No greetings of any kind when we left. I'm thankful Nick & Joe took care of us & helped us during our lunch out ting. As for Veronica I will make sure if I go back to this Red Robin location to never sit in her section for the lack of customer service was disappointing.

Compared to other Red Robins, this location felt more cramped and confined. I've visited much bigger, cleaner and nicer Red Robins.  However, the staff was friendly, despite being very busy, and the food was the same delicious quality that I'm used to. My burger was cooked perfectly. Since I came for Veteran's Day, I got the Double Red Tavern burger (which they were offering for free to military or veterans). I've had this burger before and it was as great as I remember, maybe even better. The fries were really crispy and go great with ranch dipping sauce. I highly recommend this combo. If you're in the Escondido area, this Red Robin will do but don't make a special trip as there are nicer locations in San Diego. The food here, however, is just as good.

I'm a regular here. Have the member card which is totally worth getting. I go at least 3 times a month. Food has always been good, and the service as well. But I always sit at the bar because I don't like to wait and they also have a good happy hour. NOTE: if your are looking for a quiet place to eat, this is not it. I can get crazy with kids and being attached to a mall. As a restaurant, top notch.

While there's nothing terrible about this particular Red Robin, there's also nothing spectacular about it. Located in the North County Mall, the restaurant looks smaller than other locations (like the UTC one) and the tables are closer together, leaving you feeling a little claustrophobic. Just walking from the hostess stand to our table was difficult as there was very little room between the tables and I was afraid I was going to hit people in the head with my purse.  Once we were seated, everything was just as good as any other Red Robin restaurant. The food, and the french fries in particular, was amazing. If only fries were considered a "healthy" food, I could sit there and dip them in ranch and be happy all day. :)  I'll definitely be back to Red Robin in the future but will likely visit the more spacious UTC location.

This place gets 1 star for the nasty disgusting bathroom. Something I don't want to see right before I sit down to eat.. Tampon applicators on the floor, No toilet paper or seat covers, and overflowing trash can. I like red robin... But if your place is nasty... You get 1 star just cause I can't give you none. Buffalo sauce that I've had at other locations though... Yum.

Got off to a rocky start with one of the  many table host. She Angelica to be exact was very rude and just seemed like she was over her job. After bringing it to managements attention, our food and beverages were on time. Food was good but won't ever spend my money there again.

We've been here twice now, the first time was so-so, tonight my food wasn't even edible.  I ordered the fish and chips and it was so greasy and flavorless, like eating fried oily mush.  Disgusting.  Both visits the fries were no where near the quality I expect from red robin, and my milkshake was surprisingly small, I wasnt given the extra metal cup like at other red robins... guess you have to pay for thay here!  I won't be visiting this location again, the service was lacking (had to ask for my husbands beer twice and my daughters milkshake was melted by the time it got there!) and the food was terrible.  I honestly would have rather gone to the food court.

Normal burger joint! I only gave it three stars because it's busier than other local red robins probably because it's located inside the mall. Been here three times with groups of 4-6 and all three times we've had to wait 15-20 minutes. They have all you can eat fries but order them early because the waiter takes a while to bring them to you! Plus side is the royal red robin loyalty card. When you sign up you get a free appetizer and free burger on your birthday month! Parking is standard mall parking.

Ordered a shroom burger, salad + a shake.  The burger was mediocre and not as good as in the past. The salad was ok, while the shake was excellent.  The server was very pleasant, but the overall service was meh.

I have had so many issues with this place it is ridiculous. I always get the to go order and the lack of customer service is insane. There have been several occasions where i have stood there waiting to be even acknowledged while i try to find someone to give me my to go order. One time i stood there at the bar waiting for the lady to say "ill be with you in a second" for so long that a waiter walked by 3 times before asking if id been helped. When i told him no he was very polite and got my order for me. He then told me the lady at the bar would ring me up. She did. Without saying a word to me. Literally.  On top of all that ive had so many order mistakes from uncooked burgers, misssing sides, and wrong drinks that its just not worth it anymore.

About a year ago I said I wouldn't go back but decided to stop by last night...MISTAKE. The food was much below expectations, my Whiskey Burger (with garden patty) isn't what it used to be...flat and tasteless and I think they are not making them as loaded as they used to be. Too bad, definitely my last visit.  And, the server was awful, too. :(

Thank you Red Robin for a fun and delicious birthday dinner tonight. Thank you for accomodating our big party of 9 plus 2 high chairs and a baby sling thing. The food was awesome like it always is and the service was friendly!!!! You guys are awesome!!!!!

Quick to seat us and our server max was on point! He was so friendly and continued to make our experience fantastic! We got a burger with bottomless fried. Literally in a bottomless container. We went to move them and they fell out! Comical!  I has the Ensenada chicken platter. Yummy flavorful healthy goodness. Overall the server is what made me give this review a five star.  Food was delish but you could grab all American food like that pretty much anywhere!  Enjoyed our visit!
Great food, Good service Newly cooked and delicious foods and very accomodating waiters. Will sure to come back.

I am a HUGE Red Robin fan.  This is my absolute favorite place to dine.  This specific location, however, could definitely use some work. My husband and I decided that since our #1 choice was closed down, we would go here for Valentine's Day.  After all, I moved to Oceanside 8 months ago, and there isn't a Red Robin nearby, so we decided Valentine's Day was a good excuse for the 25 minute drive to Escondido. We got to the restaurant, and of course it was pretty busy.  We expected that.  We put our name in, and were told a 45 minute wait.  No problem.  We let the hostess know we were going to sit at the bar until our table was ready.  My first complaint is that you cannot hear ANYTHING from the hostess stand when you are sitting at the bar.  The microphone is so quiet.  My husband had to keep going up to make sure they hadn't called our table.  Almost every party there was a party of 2, being as it was Valentine's Day, so that didn't help to hear "party of 2" and think it was us either. Once at the bar, my hubby ordered beer, and I ordered a freckled lemonade (I am pregnant.)  I asked the bartender if the tab could be moved to our table once we were seated, and he said that no, we would have to pay the tab at the bar.  Um, what?  I was going to have to pay for TWO drinks?  That didn't make any sense.  I went ahead and ordered it anyway.  The first drink was good, but the second drink had hardly any strawberries in it.  That is the part that I like.  My husband said his beer was good, of course. We ended up getting seated in the bar area around a hour later, so we actually were able to move our drinks to the table.  I was happy about that.  The bartender was actually our server and took forever to come take our order. We ordered the new tavern fries, a Whiskey River BBQ burger (veggie patty) with a salad with ranch on the side, and I cannot recall the name of the burger my husband got, but he stated twice that he wanted to add bacon to his.   The tavern fries came out first.  They were very tasty, however the server never brought out napkins.  With them being covered in cheese and sauce, napkins would have been awesome.   Then the food came out.  I didn't get any ranch with my salad, and my husband's burger came out without bacon on it.  We had to send whoever brought out the food back for the ranch and bacon.  I also still did not have any silverware, which is hard to deal with when eating salad.  I had to wait for the bartender to come back around and ask for it.  Annoying.  The food itself was good, as always.   Then the bill came.  They include a Red Robin Royalty card in the bill holder hoping you will sign up.  Well, I already have a card, so we took that card out, and put mine in with my credit card.  The bartender took the bill and brought everything back.  The receipts always say how close you are to getting your free item on the bottom.  My receipt did not say anything about my royalty card.  When I called the bartender back over, he seemed confused when I asked if he ran my card.  He said that he made a mistake, and that the royalty card in the bill actually belonged to another customer, and picked it up off of our table.  I had to stop him and explain that that was MY card, and that it wasn't ran.  I asked him to please go and put it through to both check my name on the card, and to check my purchased items.  He almost gave my card away!  I was super irritated by this point.  I got my card back, and we left. I am hoping that it was busy and confusing because of it being a holiday.  We will try it one more time, and if it doesn't improve, we will just wait until one of our monthly trips to Vegas to dine here.

I am very hesitant to give 5 stars but sometimes it's just the right thing to do. I don't go here often-maybe 5 or 6 times a year mostly due to finances-but when I do, everything is just perfect. I have never had a bad menu item, a bad wait person, a bad host/hostess or a long wait. The place is often crowded, yet we never have to wait to be seated. On our most recent visit, the hostess said "We had 2 wait staff call in sick, so please be patient. so-and-so, your waiter, will be with you as soon as he can. Everyone is covering other stations." OMG-have you ever had someone at least communicate that way? THIS is customer service. In spite of this, our waiter was at our table in less than 3 minutes, took our drink order and left us to casually read through the menu as we requested. We have even gone here during what I call the "after church" time-that  1-2ish time on Sunday after the late church services when it's really loud and full. Makes not a bit of difference-still the same great food and service. Like other reviewers, this in one of my favorite casual dining places. WAY TO GO, RED ROBIN!  BTW-It was here that I discovered french fries dipped in ranch dressing. The fries here are really good but better like this.
This Red Robin never fails to deliver an excellent meal with great service. I highly recommend this Red Robin location with no hesitation.

Mediocre service. Great food!  Sign up for the Red Royalty card! They send you coupons, every year you get a free meal for the month of your birthday and for every 10 meals bought, you get a free one.  Also, if you're getting a meal with their amazing steak fries, you can ask for some before your meal as an appetizer and they won't charge you.

Let me start with the fact I love me some Red Robin! Sadly this location has been hit or miss for me. I have had a few great servers and many mediocre ones. My last visit really disappointed me with the worst server I have ever had (empty drinks, forgetting parts of the order, never checking on us, etc.) as well as ordering a yummy cheese cake for dessert only to have it come out rock hard frozen. I understand they can't have fresh cheese cake laying around all the time, but why wouldn't they at least let us know they didn't have any thawed out at that time? If we had known that we would have opted for a different dessert or skipped it all together. Instead I left feeling unsatisfied and pretty disappointed. Hopefully our next visit will prove to be a better experience.
Gotta love their burger and fries! I'm a big fan of just a plain burger and fries and Red Robin is my standard. It's one of my top favorite places for burgers.

The lowered rating is for the service tonight.  The waiter seems to be always in a hurry.  He comes to say he'll be right back.  He comes back again only to say he needs to do something else.  All through out our meal, he seems distracted and in a hurry.  When we do get his attention, all our refills (drinks and chips) have piled up.  After this kind of service, he had the audacity to tell us, "Boy!  You guys are hungry!"  (because he has to bring 3 drink re-fills and chips all at the same time!). Well, since we had to wait for service, I guess we ARE hungry!  If only they bring back those online survey requests asking about your dining experience; the wait staff ore on their best behavior then.  But the freckled lemonade is still good.

We have been sitting for an hour and 15 minutes with no food took 28 minutes to get drinks very bad service.   If they try to seat you outside or in the hallway where they sat us you might as well just get up and leave because that's the area that they have the attitude they will get to you when they get to you or just forget you all together until you go in and complain.     Mike the manager did come out and finally got our order correct and did take a large amount off the bill off which was nice.

The crispy chicken burger brings me back here.  Love the honey mustard dressing too.  Great selection of food and good for families.   If you're a lover of the milkshake, try one at red robin.  They know how to make them here. Also like the can crafted cocktails here.  Hits the spot!

Lets be real, the only reason I come here is because my mom likes it.  If it were up to me, I would never pick this eatery.  That being said, this is a great place for familys with kids, younger kids at that. They have a couple arcade games at the front and a kid friendly menu.  For adults I didn't feel there were too many choices. Mainly burgers and salads, which I guess is what this restaurant is about. I usually always order the southwestern chicken salad. Good, not very spicy.  Also if your meal comes with fries, the fries are endless. So eat up!  If your looking for a regular ol burger, then this is your spot.

I've been coming here for years, and it's always been about the same story... the food is great (both burgers and fries), but the service is mediocre at best.  I've had to deal with all sorts of service-related issues here.  Recently, came with a group of friends and we asked for some fries to be brought out before our burgers.. usually, not a problem.  This time, they said that there weren't any fries ready and there was a backlog of people waiting for them... that's one I haven't heard before.  Instead of going and checking or putting our name in to make sure we got some, the waitress went over to the bar and chatted with a co-worker.  Finally after about 15 minutes, we got a single plate with about 15 fries on it... and since there were 3 people in my group, that meant 5 fries for each of us... bummer.  Next was trying to get refills on drinks.  It took multiple requests and quite a long time to get a refill. With all the negative out of the way, I will say that the food here is pretty good.  I've been happy with pretty much every burger I've tried (the new smoke & pepper one is amazing!).  The fries are always piping hot, and they're always generous with whatever dipping sauce you want (I am partial to the blue cheese dressing).   Hopefully someday, they'll work out the service issues.  We'd come here more often if it was more consistent on the service side of things.

usually I have a good experience at red robin but today when I got my burger, the whole bottom bun was covered in grease/oil and my sweet potato fries were soggy. the food here is usually average but today it was less than average quality. servers however are always extremely nice, but there was one guy who was singing kind of loud which I thought was inappropriate and frankly quite annoying since he was working. 2 stars because I don't like my burgers and fries with a side of grease.

The food here is always good.  Not the healthiest options but you can customize your order to your liking. I always order the turkey burger and add a chicken breast on a whole wheat bun.  So delicious and tons of protein.   I go here at least once a month because I have 3 little girls who love it.  The service is hit or miss.  Nice and convenient when you have some shopping to do cause its at the mall.

Reservation system is terrible. U cant make a reservation. U just put your name on a random list. I put my name in. They say wait is 45 minutes. I get there 45minutes later then I have to wait another 20 minutes. I wait 20 minutes then she says I have 10 minutes. What kind of system do you guys use? I love the food but this is rediculous. Definetly need a better system. I like how they can text u when your table is ready. Thats it.

Food is great but service is mediocre.  Even with technology they still forget to type in your name on the iPad.  Manager did his best to make it up by providing a discount on the check.  Maybe try a little harder to get teenagers that care about their job?

Alright...I should have left when a hostess told us that we have to wait 10 mins for a table for 2 at 4pm.  Keep in mind that the restaurant is quite empty and there were plenty of tables available including 4 servers at the bar just talking around doing absolutely nothing.  We were finally seated after 10 mins. The server came up to us was just very "unhappy" to do her job. I asked for her to bring me some fries while we were waiting for our food. We ordered Garlic Fries and she brought us regular fries.  A food runner came out and brought us out food about 15 mins later, right after he dropped off our food, she came over and ask how everything taste when neither of us have touched our food.  Oh such a disappointment at another Red Robin location! Management really need to get it together.
Gourmet burgers are great here had the burning love and it left me loving this place recommend that burger

Ohhhh mang!! What a disappointment!  Ok, I'm just talking about the food here- the service was great- my waitress was funny, fast, n friendly! :) So when I used to live in collierville, TN.. I used to go to Red Robin to get my favorite BanzAi burger- yeah the one with juicy n sweet pineapple in ur burger.. Yeah that one.. At least twice a week...  I used to LOVE that burger- just the thing about the pineapple in my food.. I dunno I love it- I love pineapple in my pizza, burger, juice, the hot spicy spring roll sauce that my mom makes.. I dunno.. I love it.. So here I was at red robin today.. Reminiscing about my good old days.. Trying to have that yummy banzai burger bite back. Mang. It has been about four years or more since I have been here.. Since I left Memphis.. Ok anyways. Red robin changed a lot since then- They used to give big fat steak potato fries that I wasn't a big fan of.. But tonight, the steak was a lot better becuz it was skinnier n tasted pretty darn good with spicy chili dipping sauce I got- oh btw, if u want that sauce, u have to pay extra 75 cents- our waitress warned us ab the extra few cents before I ordered it:) The burger def wasn't what I expected.. The buns were soggier.. N the pineapple were not juicy n sweet as I remembered =\. Hmmm maybe my taste buds are spoiled.. But yeah.. It was alright :( I probably won't come back to red robin if i stay in cali.. =\

I love this place. The food is almost always delicious, there is a wide assortment of food, including burgers, wraps, salads, steaks, and I think they do fish. They have a full bar, and they cater to several drinks that aren't on the menu.  The look of the place is definitely themed, lots of red, but not too much. They have loads of paraphernalia relating to red robin being in all places of the US, and they have several pictures/ paintings that are parodies of famous ones. There is plenty of seating, and the chairs and tables are all comfortable.  The staff and service is above average for a restaurant such as this. The waiters are always friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful, and can always suggest something good.  The only downside I can think of is the wait time for food, but it could definitely be because they do everything else fast and I can't wait to start eating!

Best service we've had at a red robin in years. Our server was Veronica, she was very attentive although she had most of the tables in our half of the restaurant, she still managed to make us feel welcome. The food was good although my Colossus burger made it to the table without the brisket (reason for 4 stars), it was corrected quickly though. Margaritas are on point, chipotle marg is my favorite, sweet with a spicy finish. Service was outstanding from start to finish. Thank you again Veronica
Great service. Sign up for Red Royalty to get a free appetizer, free 10th burger & more!

This is the only Red Robbin I have been to. The food is great, I like the environment. Although upon my recent experience with my gf. Our chicken tortilla soup was extremely watery. I asked the manager for a non watery soup. She smiled and apologized, while taking my dish. We then received another soup, just as watery as the first. That is why what I would normaly rate 4-5 stars Is now a 2star valued restraunt. Hope they fix their soup, so I can go back and enjoy some, alongside the delicious BBQ chicken wrap

Came here on a Friday night and had the expected 25 min wait. Reuniting with my 4 cousins from the east coast, we grabbed a few drinks at the bar til the table was ready. Bartender Matt took care of us right away! Was super sweet and drinks came out quick :) Once seated, Leita was AMAZING! Such an easy going and sweet server - very attentive and easy to talk to ! Clicked with her right away and she made our stay very pleasant and enjoyable! Best server I've had in a while ! Food was great and consistent as usual.

Great food, great service and not as noisy inside like Red Robin in Temecula or Menifee.  We have been going to Red Robin for years and the ones in Valencia, CA. and Escondido, CA are the best.   Other locations need to see how it SHOULD be done.

When I go I get the chicken plater with no ranch sauce but more times than not the sauce is on it. Why is it so hard to leave the sauce off. The manager comes by to apologize and says he's glad I understand, but I don't understand. Not the smartest manager. I continually have to remind them about drinks, fries and the bill. This will be the last time.

I came in today with my girlfriend . We were extremely hungry when we arrived . The hostess informed us that  there was a 15 minute wait for a party of two, so we decided to stay. We were surprisingly seated in ten minutes. Our server Stephanie immediately greeted us. She took our order and was quick in bringing us our drinks. our food arrived within 15 minutes and within those 15 minutes she had refilled my strawberry lemonade regardless of how busy the restaurant was. The food was hot and delicious and the customer service was on point. Stephanie was friendly and attentive to our needs. It was overall a wonderful experience tonight especially because of our server. We will definitely be back soon.

Went to this location on 8/2/14 @ 6pm. After standing in the front waiting to be acknowledged by the hostess, another group comes in after and the hostess decides to greet and help them first. Me and my girlfriend were clearly there first. The hostess that was working at this time needs to get fired. I will never come back to this location because of her..NEVER. I will also tell all my friends and family to not go to this location either.

I will never come back to this red robin. I came tonight it was a horrible experience. We came on Saturday at around 6:00pm through the inside of the mall and the hostess did not greet us and avoided eye contact as she spoke on her headset and chit chatted with another hostess. Four people were seated waiting and probably already gave their name and we thought okay maybe they are just busy we'll just stand to the side front and wait as the hostess as she continued to ignore us as we were right in front of her. I've never experienced such rude service as she intentionally ignored us. Maybe ten minutes later a group of 7 people enter she makes eye contact and looks at the 7 people and says to them "how many?", as she had failed to make eye contact, look or acknowledge our presence which obviously was there before any those 7 people who had just entered minutes after us. I don't now what her problem is, but she has no respect right in front of us as we were there first. Management needs to reevaluate who they hire because she had some prejudice towards us which was obvious to the people who were there before us watching in the lobby as she mistreated us and helped out people who came after. Thanks Red Robin hostess for avoiding us? We left after her helping the group of 7.

I gave this place a second chance after having uncooked chicken the first time around, and have to say I won't be going back. When they brought our food, the girl handed hot plates over my baby's head! Wtf! Second, my burger was ok, I ordered the Banzai Burger, but the bottom bun was so saturated in sauce that I couldn't eat it. Third, I ordered a side of fruit for my son. What I got was a bowl of fruit swimming in syrup, disgusting.

I don't know why I have gone back to Red Robin.  I started rethinking my relationship with this old flame about one year ago when I tried to opt-out of their emails for the reward program, however you can't opt-out unless you want to opt-out of all the rewards you have generated as well.  A little disappointing overall. About 6 to 9 months ago, my family watched a cockroach crawl across the floor.  Other tables noticed.  I called a server over who was freaked out by it.  A manager came over and he covered it with a napkin and tried to just scoop it up and dispose of it.  The cockroach was too quick for him and was able to escape.  At that point, the manager finally decided to take the situation into his hands... or rather... onto the bottom of his shoe.  CRUNCH!!! "Check please!!!" Despite these experiences, I decided to take the adventure one more time by going to there again.  Don't know why.  I think my family over-ruled me and it was convenient, plus it couldn't get any worse, right? Well, sorry Red Robin.  It's not me... it's you.  The bun on my chicken sandwich tasted cheap.  My fries were extraordinarily cold and tasted like rubber.  I haven't had a basketball in my mouth, however the rubber-factor of your fries on this given night reminded me of just that... a basketball. No more.  Fool me once, shame on you.  Fool me twice... well... umm... you won't get fooled again.  Something like that right?

Went here today for my wife's birthday burger! Our server, Austin, gave absolutely top-notch service. We got the Crispy Chicken Burger (free for her) and I got the Clucks n' Fries. Austin brought us refills on our bottomless fries and Freckled Lemonades without prompt and with immaculate timing. We are regulars, and service like this keeps us coming back!

Slow service. Sunday night football deserved more of a tip than our waiter since it kept us entertained while we waited over 40 mins on our food. If it wasn't for the game we would have left a while ago. We ordered an appetizer and the waited even forgot to bring it out. Our food arrived and i asked about the appetizer and she said she was sorry and that she did not even place the order. The manager came over and apologized  and said the appetizer was on him so he save this review from becoming two starts. A bottle of beer is also $5.69.

Excellent food! I got the Red Robin Gore Cheese Burger with American and bacon. Only thing is that the bartender used sweet and sour mix in the Tom Collins I ordered. Instead of lime juice. I knew it did not taste right. Very Weird.

My bf and I had a craving for their yummy hamburgers,  so we decided to take the drive.  Our appetizer,  the cluck and fries I believe,  was very delicious.  Tenders and fries cooked to perfection!  By the time we got our hamburgers I was full with the appetizer.  Our server,  Melanie I believe,  was awesome!  Top notch,  grade A service!  My bf didn't really like his hamburger, but we're not one to really complain so we just asked for the check.  Melanie noticed he didn't really eat it and comped the meal cause he had hardly touched it.  Wow!  She truly is the epitome of great customer service.  She made the experience great.  Extremely attentive,  knowledgeable and she was a sweetheart!  Def will be going back again. ..

The wait time quotes are ridiculous. We were quoted 30 minutes and at an hour and 15 minutes we still haven't been seated. We have a small child and would have gone elsewhere if we knew the wait would be that long. Ridiculous.

Not up to the standards of the other red robins. The place was filthy menus's sticky and a long wait time to have my order taken at 7:45. They were very short staffed and it made things worse. I come back because I love the food but this one is not best I have been too!

We visited in the late afternoon on a weekday so it wasn't crowded. I'm not a big fan of the decor (every inch of the walls covered in pictures) although I do appreciate the ample amount of booths that the have.  We were seated quickly and greeted within 2 minutes, although our server Max was tasked with 5 tables in our vicinity, I have to say that he was really on the ball. He moved quickly and handled them all with ease.  He was friendly, very helpful with suggestions and had no problems with special orders. He thoughtfully brought our burger already cut in half along with two plates. He also was quick with the refills so we didn't have to ask. I love that! I noticed that he was attentive to his other tables as well. I really liked that when we asked for something that he immediately went to retrieve it. Some servers will will make you wait ten minutes for something so that the can combine their trips to the kitchen. Max made us feel like he really cared about his customers.  Strawberry Lemonade: Comes in a cool looking glass, has real strawberries and has a great fresh taste. It even comes with refills! ($3.00) Yukon chips and French onion dip: The dip reminds me my childhood days when we used to make our own from the Lipton onion soup mix.  (5.00) The (onion) O-ring shorty: love the flavor of the crispy rings and the size was just right for three to share. Jalapeño coins: These are so addictive. Deep fried pickled jalapeños! Yummy! Smoke & Pepper burger: I have to say it wasn't my favorite burger. But in defense of Red Robin I have to say that I was asked to share with someone else. I prefer American cheese and no ketchup not cheddar. The burger itself was cooked perfectly (juicy) medium rare and seasoned well. If I had ordered a regular cheeseburger it would have been perfect.  Bacon Cheeseburger: Juicy and delicious. I wasn't in love with the garlic fries so I'll order them plain next time. Overall our visit here was pleasant and the food was tasty. We will be back.

Love this place.  Myself - - - and now my family have been eating here for years and years.  Super kids menu.  Great food. Excellent burgers beef or chicken (saw you can get turkey burgers as well now)  My favorite is the Teriaki Chicken burger!  Perfect for family or casual lunch or dinner. Menu selection is large, and prices are average $8 to $9 for most entrees.  Waitstaff always seems to be friendly and very accommodating to specific or special requests.  Coming here on Friday or weekend for dinner can be crazy busy,  so expect to wait for 15 to 30 minutes during peak times. But you got the mall so who can't kill a few minutes before eating.  Highly recommended.

As an avid Red Robin fan, my sister & I decided to swing in for a quick basket of fries and some happy hour drinks. Kim, our server in the bar made us both feel like an inconvenience. We asked about the pricing for a well gin n' tonic & she responded by saying she couldn't possibly know all the prices off the top of her head, which is justifiable if the prices were on the menu.. But they weren't.  We then asked for some roll ups with our fries since we didn't receive any one out food was dropped off and she responded with "we don't do that here anymore" and literally tossed a stack of paper napkins on our table. She didn't smile once nor say your welcome to any of our thank you's. As we checked out she just left the bill on the table without a bill holder and simply clipped my credit card to the bill with a pen.  I understand she was likely busy, but she needs to slow down and show some customer service to those sitting right in front of her. I would have requested to speak with management, but respected that it was a busy lunch hour. I hope that management will address this.

I have dined at several Red Robins and always enjoy the food. My boyfriend and I had the best service I have ever received at a Red Robin in Escondido. They were very crowded, but we were seated right away and we were very impressed at how fast our food came. We had to wait a little while (not very long) for the check and our waiter, Max, was very apologetic and offered us a free Sunday and drinks to go. The food was good, the service was great, and it made for a very nice spontaneous date out.

Red's Tavern Double Burger was as delicious as it looked. It was juicy and very flavorful. It reminded me of A&W's burgers back in the 60s. That was when you had to wait 10-15 minutes to get your food because it was freshly grilled. I had their house salad with blue cheese dressing and it was very delicious. I also ordered the Very Berry Limeade drink. I didn't enjoy it - it tasted more like Sprite with a lime wedge dropped in, and maybe a dash of berry flavoring for color but the overall taste was Sprite. It was a very busy night. All the staff on the floor were hustling. Yet they were not too busy to check on my order. Every employee I passed smiled and thanked me for being there.

Great customer service, l had a little issue with my whiskey burger and they took it back to make sure my experience was perfect! Our waitress, Veronica , and the manager, Arturo , we're on the ball! Great time and of course my October fest was very cold, good job guys!

Husband and I had lunch here on our way to the Safari Park.  Pretty tasty!  We were seated right away despite it being lunch hour.  Our server was really nice!  I ordered the whiskey river chicken salad and a side of fries.  My husband had a burger and fries.  I was really hungry so I was so happy when my side of fries came out before the rest of the food.  We totally nommed on them.   Our waitress kept our drinks full and offered suggestions when we asked for them.  Oh!  And I got my birthday burger.  I don't love that you have to carry a card around to be part of that club but I did earn a free burger when we ate there!

Every time I think of Red Robin, I just remember how they've been included (multiple times) in articles that feature the highest calorie foods in America.  That's not to say they don't have food that tastes good here - how can you make something that tastes bad with that many calories?! The last time I was here I just came for a quick happy hour after an exhausting day of Christmas shopping!  My friend ordered a beer ($3.25) and I had a margarita ($5), and we shared an order of parmesan herb fries (which weren't on happy hour).  While sitting in the bar, service was quick and it wasn't too crowded.  The fries were surprisingly good, and I'd definitely order them again. Generally feels a little dirty and even if it's not, the decor and ambiance gives it the appearance of being dirty. I don't think I would come out of my way to eat at Red Robin, but it's not a bad place to stop for a casual experience while at the mall.  I was tempted to give it 3 stars, but my last experience was better than I had remembered it being and the service was high quality!
Great food/ burgers but they often drop your name off the list and you wait over an hour extra. F this place...

Ive always enjoyed my meal here but the last two times ive come the food and the service has been off. I want to say maybe because of the holidays and being busy....but.  I think it will be a while before I return.

Our server Matt was very friendly and attentive. was fabulous, but the food came out cold and not what we ordered. It has been a long time since I have dined at Red Robin and my meal today reminded me why I won't be back.
Friendly service and live the BBQ chicken  whisky river burger. Our family favorite.  Try the garlic fries. Full bar btw ;)

I love Red Robin and always have, but this location continues to screw up "To Go" orders.  We ordered the clucks and fries, with 2 extra orders of fries, and a chicken Caesar salad.  We received our clucks and fries with 1 extra order of fries with no ranch, which is supposed to come with the chicken as well as the fries.  The Caesar salad did not come with any dressing at all!  This is the second time I've ordered a salad to go and received it with no salad dressing.  Aside from that, the food made all four of us sick a few hours later.  I understand that there are bound to be less than perfect orders, let's face it that is just inevitable, but come on!  It's not like we ordered items and made all sorts of changes to them.  I will try this location again because I truly feel that mistakes happen and will not let this experience completely ruin Red Robin for me.

Worst service I have ever received. .. it was like I wasn't even there.. I sat at the bar and was greeted by a nice lady. The male bartender took over from there and let's just say he was just to busy hitting on the women then taking care of all the customers.

My son loves mac and cheese here so we come here frequently. Today we had to wait for 40 mins and when they called us, they took us outside which is disappointing as I was watching the game. Now waiting again for 20 mins and no food yet. Next time RR, ask first where your customers would like to sit!!

Great experience, my wife and I told the hosts we didn't want a small table, they informed  us it would be a little longer wait; cool beans.  Our server  was Ben, he was fanominal job, he wasn't to naggy or overbearing he only stopped by when it looked like we needed his assistance, and he spoke very highly of his supervisor.  Great job red Robin of Escondido mall.  I really enjoyed your services....... compared to Charlies subs earlier today, total shit sandwich! 4 out of 5, only because of no military discount!  Still a great place to eat.

Great chain restaurant! My favorite items when I go here are the burgers and the bottomless fries. Oh and the strawberry lemonades are pretty darn good too!  Best burger is the Royal Robin Burger it's a burger with a fried egg in it and it is amazing! Service is pretty good here too.  Since it is a chain restaurant there all over the place and all their staff are really nice even the busboys.

Great place to relax & enjoy good food after work or shopping.  Restaurant is located inside/attached to the north county mall.  Hubby & I went there a few days ago for dinner.  Hubby had the Big Sky burger which he says was amazing! Cant beat the bottonless fries & freckled lemonaide! I had the chicken crossiant sandwich...deff recommend this to anyone who is looking to change it up from a burger!!  Service was good & quick!
Good food for a great price. Server a little bland and slow on the service but nice ambiance. Would come again.
I was sat with in 2 minutes. My waitress was great and informative. I ordered the burger with an egg on top. This place had a great vibe. I haven't been here in 15 years and yes I will come back.

Don't know why it's taken me so long to review this place as I've been coming here for years at least for my free birthday meal and same for my wife hahaha. They've finally come around to serving their meals in plates as opposed to trays- makes it more gourmet and makes it easier for you to realize that you're spending $30-$40 for a few burgers and drinks omg!!! They be updated their TVs to flat screens and even renewed their arcade section! Their food is okay but their service is always excellent. The dining area is always on point! Thanks for keeping me full each year...

I think we are just about done with this Red Robin location. The service has been slipping for about the past year. We are now getting mediocre service about once in every three visits. Today was the capper for me. First, when we arrived we were told that the wait is about 25 minutes. We gave the staff our phone number so that we could get a text when a table is ready. After about 35 minutes, we inquired about the timing. It will be another 15 minutes, they said. After another 20 minutes we inquired again. It will be another five minutes. In all, our 25 minute estimate turned into an hour. Is this red robin location just that bad at forecasting? I guess so. One of the young female hostesses seemed very put out by us asking for updates on the timing as well. Maybe she was having a bad day. Regardless, she shouldn't be so obvious about the disdain she had for our questions. Finally, our server was not attentive. I had an empty glass that needed refilling. She went by at least three times and stopped at our table twice before I asked her for a refill. There was no way that she was going to offer on her own. We also asked for no seasoning on one person's fries. We ended up getting no seasoning on anyone's fries. Additionally, our chips and baja dip were sorry. The chips were so greasy (wet) that we had to get a replacement. The server didn't notice? How did they get to us in that sorry state?  All around? Just a poor effort by this location today. We will stick with the UTC location.

I LOVE Red Robin. However, one star for service at this location. HORRIBLE.  We went and sat at the bar on a busy weekend afternoon. They had 2 people manning the bar. But the second we sat down, rude. The woman and man BOTH never made eye contact. No pleasantries, no hello, no smile, no nothing. I'm sorry but that is SO off-putting. We were starving though so we tried to ignore it. It took them 20  minutes to take a drink order. Every time we tried to holler at them, they would look away. Uh ok. We ordered drinks and food, asked for fries out first. 20 more minutes pass and so my sister finally asks the lady if the fries would be out. She glares at my sister and says "Yeah..I put it in." That was said with a side of bad attitude. My sister replied "I know, I was just checking to see if you had remembered seeing as it's so busy here..no need to be rude". And the lady looked at us and said with attitude "I'm just letting YOU know I already did." Ok. We really considered leaving but again, the hunger won out. Then the lady goes to her male server friend and looks ar us and obviously is whispering about us. And then what happens? The guy is now our server. And he was equally rude. I felt like I was burdening him when I said we were ready to order. "Ok, I will..I need to finish my other orders first." Like honestly, a big WTF to this. So we ate and the manager wasn't around so I decided to write here. And seeing other reviews, I see that service is HELLA poor here. So just beware. Ugh.

Went to Red Robin for Daughters bday party, What a mistake.  We got order in, that went well, but then, one dish was wrong. They fixed it, got food, but everyone's burger was well done, over cooked,  and dry,  not very tasty.  Waitress never came back to check on us to see if there was a problem until we finished the meal, then it was a little late.  She asked why we never said anything, and I said because you never came back to check on us.  When she brought the check, it was wrong, and no one would clear the dishes.  I guess they do not bus your table until you leave.  The waitress was very nice and apologized for all the problems, however, $25 for 2 tiny burnt burgers I think was a little expensive.  You can go to many other restaurants and get a 1/2 lb burger for a lot less, like Rossis or Islands

Ah Red Robin. I remember those days of coming in religiously for my Birthday and your all you can eat steak fries. We had pretty good service so no complaints there. Funny thing is I actually got a salad this time, which I felt was a little expensive for a salad. But maybe that's all relative I guess.
Blue ribbon was not so good tonight! They changed the bun and gave me a little hockey puck patty. Definitely not our best visit!

If it weren't for our first waitress passing us off to someone else, this review would have been less than 2 stars. I do however love the food at Red Robin, especially the Banzai Burger and the fries with ranch, but a restaurant shouldn't solely rely on their tasty food to get by. One of the few problems I encountered at this location was that most of the staff appeared to be completely clueless. I was baffled at how awful they were actually. They weren't even busy and we waited at the front for someone to seat us for 5 or more minutes. Several employees even acknowledged that we were standing there waiting and didn't come over to say a word to us, which is completely rude. Once we were seated, it took only a few minutes for a waitress to come over and take our drink order. Along with that, we ordered the "bottomless" fries. On a side note, what is the deal with Red Robin's so called "bottomless" fries? Every single location I go to does the same exact thing when I ask for a basket of the "bottomless" fries. They come back with a basket of about 7 French fries and expect two people to share them. It's basically a race to get to the 7th fry because no one is satisfied with eating only 3 fries. Come on now! It took a while for our 7 fries to get to our table. Our waitress claimed that a new batch was being made. I'm assuming if a new batch really was being made, they could afford to give us more than 7 fries since they weren't busy, but I digress. After roughly a few minutes passed, my boyfriend and I were done with the fries and put the empty basket toward the edge of the table for our waitress to take and refill. Conveniently, she walked passed our table several times, ignoring us and the basket we had placed right in front of her face. She seemed to check up on every other table in her section except for the one with the empty fry basket. I actually find it comical. I am not mad at all. It just seems like this always happens at every Red Robin. Are they trained to do this? Right when we sensed that our food was about to come out, our waitress finally stopped by our table, giving us the opportunity to ask for more fries. Sure enough, a minute later our food came out and we really didn't need the extra fries anymore. Go figure. I hate to call anyone out, but our waitress just seemed dazed. Maybe she was having a bad day or something. It happens. I was just disappointed with her lack of checking up on us. She couldn't even remember what drinks we ordered and all we got was a coke and water. As she continued to pass us without stopping, we started looking around to see if we could make eye contact with another server. A few employees looked at us and looked away. Finally, something great happened! We got a new server (shift switch or something). Our new waiter was so attentive and quick. If it weren't for him, I would have left there thinking much less of this location. I still don't think very highly of the service at Red Robin in general (the fry conspiracy bothers me the most) but lucky for them, I love their food and will keep going back for more.

AMBIENCE: Great place for big parties. And free burger on your birthday month, so make sure you sign up to get the red robin loyalty card!  FOOD: Bottomless everything! When I go to red robin, I always get a burger with bottomless garlic fries. And if I'm feeling really hungry, I add the bottomless rootbeer float (w/ soft serve). Decent burgers, I don't recommend the chicken burgers, they are dry.  SERVICE: great service at the bar area, servers are very attentive and always happy the last few time I've been! They work very hard getting those bottomless fries and rootbeer float refills for me!

Slow service! Cold fries! Asking twice for ranch and not receiving any! A cold chicken sandwich! Having to ask for drink refills! Old crumbly buns! Having to ask our server to let us pay! When these powers combine, they form the Captain Planet of terrible food service! Only this Captain's name is Red Robin. I've never wanted to walk out of a restaurant after receiving my order until today. In fact, if it wasn't for the fish and chips, I would have. I'm definitely not coming back to this place, ever.
Service was ok. Mediocre service accompanied by cheap prices. I would have killed for a fry refill. What do you expect. Ready set go

I've been going here since I was a child back before they moved to their current location and I still love their burgers fries and shakes, I will definitely continue to go here for years to come you can count on that!

Initial presentation of food was good but chicken was a little overcooked and dry. I ordered the Ensenada chicken platter...notified the server and a replacement chicken was there in less than 3 minutes and perfect. Bruce the manager stopped by to make sure that everything was correct and that we were satisfied. Our server who just got married never let my beverage go empty and our bottomless fries were always burn your mouth hot.

Decided to stop here to eat a late lunch on a Saturday, around 3:30pm, thinking there would be no waiting for a table. The hostess said it would be a 25 minute wait, but we were seated at our table for four within 13 minutes. I have eaten at this location several times through the years and it still looks the same, but more worn out. The wall next to where I was sitting had what looked like dried milkshake splatter. The Men's restroom was very filthy, smelled worse than a public park restroom! Our waitress, Analisa, did an excellent job! She took the ladies orders and served their food first, before the men! She made sure our drinks were always full. I ordered the BLTA Croissant Sandwich. It was delicious! Everything in the sandwich was fresh and tasted really good! The croissant was soft, flaky, and tasted buttery like it came out fresh from a bakery. Their signature bottomless steak fries were hot and cooked just right!

This visit was based purely on nostalgia.  Some friends from WA. and I were talking about Jr. High days, prompted by my Whatcom Falls review recently and we reminisced that another staple of those days was bottomless fries at Red Robin (with a side of ranch). Then we started talking about their milkshakes, then the burgers, then we were all singing the Red Robin birthday song (and clapping) so we had to head over to recount it all with an actual experience.  When I was 15, I don't remember the throngs of children and parents - just the thrill of being at a restaurant with boys and without my folks. I don't recall the servers rolling their eyes at a group of teenagers ordering the cheapest things on the menu - just basket after basket of pipping hot fries and strawberry lemonades. I don't remember thinking about the quality of the food, but rather, just trying not to turn as red as their mascot bird when my birthday and a sundae arrived to the embarrassing tune of their servings singing the birthday song. It was all a small town sunday afternoon after the mall thing for me.  My grown up visit recently wasn't as magical, but hey, times have changed. The fries where still good (although lacking in amounts they first dropped at the table, literally the BF had less than a handful on the side of his burger in the first round) and my older - now tummy flipped at the idea of a milkshake (I had reached my dairy limit for the day).
