We noticed all the baby cries and server faux pas - gone was the blissful experience of my youth. The burger though, was yummy and tasted just like 'merica... the memories kept the dinner alive.  I'll return when I'm in need for a basket of fries again, and I'm sure the past will continue to sooth any thoughts that might prompt anything less than 3 stars.

This had to be the worst service I have ever had at a Red Robin. She took forever to take our order coming by several times to say she would be right with us. When the food finally arrived after a long time it was cold.  The manager came over and brought new food he said it looked like it had been sitting in the window a while.  We then asked for boxes, got some but we were told we would have to wait for her to get the bowl from the front...ok that came after we saw her pass by us twice and then go sing happy birthday for someone.  We asked for the bill, she finally brought it...it was someone else's bill more than double what we ordered.  The manager came over and said there should be no way ours would be $73 because ours should have been around $6.00 because he took stuff off... It wasn't it was $18 and I have no idea what I paid for as I wasn't given an itemized receipt...won't be going back here again, I can tell you the one in Temecula is great....

Red Robin was a staple when I was in high school and college.  I used to frequent this location when it was on the first floor all the way on the other side of the mall.  I often times miss visiting at its' original location but it's ok.  The food remains the same and thats whats really important. I've tried many burgers from all over, NY, Los Angeles. San Diego.  Red Robin isn't my favorite but its definitely one of the burger spots that I love to go to.  If you have trouble picking a burger, go with the Blue Ribbon, Peppercorn, Whisky River, or Royal.  Those are some great burgers.  It comes with bottomless fries as well so you can eat at your hearts content!   Service is also pretty good and I've never had a problem at this location.  Go for the burgers and fries!  You won't be disappointed.

Prices aren't that good for burger fare. Anyway, we're here so we get the bleu burger. 15 bucks later we notice it looks nothing like the picture. No blue cheese, just sauce of some kind that turns the bun into a sponge. Overdone as well. We send it back and the next burger is better. Also, the sign on the door says great drink specials all day. Sounds good and we're thirsty but we find out the only beer special is coors light. Boo. This place is competing with BJ's in the same parking lot who, everyone knows, has outstanding lunch beer specials. RR Missed the boat there. Manager took care of us though with the swapped out burger and comp.
Good food but a limited menu....worth checking out for a decent burger. The atmosphere is good and they always have sports on all the tvs...so that's a plus.

Love coming here for the bottomless fries,  no seasoning.  Hard to pick a burger as they all look good.  I am in a sodium restricted diet,  so I get no salt on everything.  They are really nice and accommodating.

Great service and great food. Came here with the fam. My girlfriend liked her food though she's really picky and hard to please. Service was quick, friendly, and the right balance of check in on us but also not being intrusive.

Overall 3.5 stars.  The NCF location has always been really friendly and compared to the Temecula and UTC locations, always had better service than those locations. TIP: Join their Red Royalty club for a free burger in your birthday month! Plus free burger after every 10th burger/entree/salad.  I just wish the CV location (or rather, all locations) participated in the Red Royalty birthday club. I'm not a big "chain restaurant" person, but their burgers are always well made, taste good and not greasy or salty compared to other restaurants. My only "complaint" is that the bathrooms are always kind of gross. They need to clean it more frequently.  Other than that, we've always loved the service at this location.
Just had lunch. Got here when they just opened. Seemed a little disorganized at first but we were quickly seated. Ordered and it came quickly. Food was hot and delish. Highly recommend.

I'm not sure what high expectations I had for this red robin, since I one I frequent down in Chula Vista is always hit or miss.... But this was one of the worst services I've ever received. First we walk in and make eye contact with quite a few staffers and nobody greets us. Takes a few minutes for our hostess to come up. Next our waiter was just rude. Had an attitude problem from the start. Food took forever. Just. Very disappointed. Food was great like always but he service man....

I love Red Robin!!! I'm not a fan of chain restaurants at all but their burgers are absolutely delicious! They have gluten free buns (which are hard to come by) and can make your burger however you want it. They have great portioned children's meals and bottomless fries. Great burgers for the price but it's not "cheap" so be prepared for a $40 bill for 2 adults and one child. It's really convenient for post shopping meals and there are lots of games in the lobby for little ones.

After a few games of bowling, my friend and I worked up an appetite and since the service at the bowling place was non-existent, we opted to try some place in the mall and stumbled upon Red Robin. Instantly greeted and seated while the waitress asked us if we were apart of the Red Robin program (tip if you sign up, you get a free burger and fries for your birthday). I ordered their Robin Burger while my friend ordered their Red, White, and Bleu Salad which consists of Grilled Chicken, candied walnuts, Bleu Cheese, apples, and cranberries with a mustard dressing. My burger was typical, but my friend and I couldn't resist their seasoned fries! This place is perfect for the kiddos who are still in that picky stage and you won't feel too bad because they still have some good healthy options that falls within the U.S. Food Pyramid.

My initial review rated Red Robin in Escondido a 1 out of 5 because of really rude and poor service; I am now submitting a higher rating for the responsiveness of their customer service follow up . . . 3 for A-OK. I shared my experience via Yelp and also directly through their website. I found their website easy to navigate and welcoming of feedback. When submitting feedback there is an option to request to be contacted, which I opted for. Upon receipt of my complaint, I received several follow-up emails from various levels of the organization and felt that they made a gracious attempt to resolve the issue. I would say that contrary to what I experienced at the restaurant, the organization has placed an emphasis on customer satisfaction, which I appreciate!

We eat here a lot.  Love the food. I have a complaint though.  The last two times we've eaten at the one in Escondido, the buns fell apart even before we started eating.  I don't like eating a hamburger with a knife and fork and that's what we had to do both times.  The service is great and generally I'd give the food a 5 star.  Not today, especially since we had the same problem two weeks ago.

I was STARVING. Rushed home from work, grabbed my daughter and we quickly decided on Red Robin. We haven't been here or to any RR in atleast 6 years and the food nailed the roar in my belly. Our server Courtni was perfect, no annoying fake up sales, told her I was starving, she had a cup of soup to me fast before our meals and they were busy in there. very easy comfortable feel. We will forsure come back.

It's a good family restaurant! Their fries and burgers are good! Service is ok. It's a hit or miss with service. It took 1hour for our food to get ready and a 45 minuet wait! Anyways their food is good
Came in with a group of 9, service was really good. Food was great! Only thing I don't care for is shredded lettuce on my burger but that's an easy fix! Very happy with my visit!

Always a crap shoot coming here, service is completely unpredictable and tonight was no exception.  10+ minutes before drink orders were taken and not 1 apology from the server.  I HATE THIS PLACE, I wish my kids did too.  No need to complain to management; done it before and they don't seem to care.   Let's see if someone reaches out to me.    And 10 minutes after drinks were ordered, the drinks finally came.
We have been loyal customers for years but our last experience was terrible.  Even though the food was good, the customer service was truly awful and that ruined our visit.

I was just here 2 days ago. Overall I liked it. We had a rough start when the hostess wanted to seat us in a tiny 2 person booth right next to the bar and the kitchen. I was already a little moody from the hunger and the commotion around the area made it worse. I had to ask her if there was anything else available because she was trying to pass by rushing waiters and basically hopping around a dirty dish cart. Really? If you can barely get in and out of this booth why would I want to sit there? Anyway after that it was better. We got seated somewhere else and our waiter was nice. After we ordered our food came and it wasn't the hottest food. It tasted as if it might have been sitting a bit too long but they apologized and were happy to fix it. I was happy that they didn't treat us like the bad guys and accepted their mistake. This made the experience better for me. I would recommend you to come here. Everyone seemed very nice and the experience was good for me.

If I could give this restaurant lower I would. We came in late afternoon on the 4th of July 3:30pm thinking it was going to be busy! Wasn't, upon entering we were greeted, gave our name and was told it would be about 5 to 10 min, lots of empty table didn't seem busy but fair enough!  We waited just under 10min and was seated, the check from the Pryor patrons was still on the table. We were given menu's and within a few min made our selections. And we waited, and we waited, severs walking by our table, a gentleman who appeared to be a manager, walked by our table. This restaurant isn't busy for Pete sake. Our patients were running out.  Finely, after waiting 20 min, I went back up to the front and told both hostesses, no one had come by to greet us nor take our order! And then she said "DO YOU WANT ME TO GET THE MANAGER" at this point I knew we were done! We walked out hungry... The lake of Customer Service, was scary. I hope someone from their corporate office reads this, and fixes this, until next time RR.  SCRC  Ron

So I've always been a big fan of Red Robin , but today my experience was worthy of a review . Our waiter Max went above and beyond what is expected in customer service . Super attentive , fast and funny. I even asked if he could bring me a soda with no ice because I was having some tooth sensitivity after he had just brought me a soda with ice . The food was super good and the prices are reasonable for the portion sizes of course . The restaurant was not to packed and we were seated quickly . Easy parking . The restaurant is a bit loud but not to bad . Overall what made us want to come back was Max's dedication to providing amazing customer service . It's hard to find that quality in anyone know a days . Keep it up ! If I could give more stars I most definitely would .

This has always been a good place to eat. And the food is very good. But the service is lousy.  People we're seated before us. We we're there first. Finally we get our table and weren't acknowledged for 6 minutes.   We ordered an appetizer and there are 4 of us and she brings 3 plates ? Never again will we grace your establishment.  No good Burger is worth poor service. OK just got our food....no set ups.  She goes and gets the set ups and puts all it down and leaves. And guess what...yes 3 napkins.
Just got take out here and it was freezing by the time I got it home...which is 5 mins away from the red robin location. It tasted like bad fast food.

First let me say even though Red Robin is a big chain restaurant they have some damn good burgers. I went on a search for the best burger in San Diego county and I tried several popular burger joints. Some fast food some sit down spots. I went to Coronado, downtown San Diego, Temecula which is in Riverside county. RR isn't fancy and the waitresses don't wear skimpy uniforms but the prices are good, the burgers are great and they have bottomless fries. This location is cool because it's at the mall so you could walk off your meal. The restaurant is pretty big and they have a nice size bar.  The places I tried which included Fat Burger, Burger Lounge, In and Out which I hate, Smash Burger, The Counter, Hoo Dads, Habit, Leroy's in Coronado, Ty's burger in Oceanside and Nessy burger in Fallbrook. Out of all of those in 3rd place is you guessed Red Robin. The runner up is The Counter in San Diego I think they moved to the San Diego airport and my number one burger spot out of the ones I listed is Leroy's because the burgers are juicy and they use grass fed beef.  Ok so that's enough Red Robin is my number 3 and I will be back like Arnold Schwarzenegger.
great burgers, excellent flavor and had the best waitress ever.. ill always come back.!!
Unsatisfactory.  Walked in waiting to be seated.  A couple of waitresses look at us but ignored us. Stood around for 5 minutes and walked out.

Food is still alright, but man - the staff and our server, Kim, needs to go back to charm school.  She was not warm and/or friendly.  In fact, one of the tables next to us asked where his cheese was on his burger, and she said something to the effect of "Would you like me to get you your cheese? Would that make your life easier?" LOL! Omg I would NEVER say that to a guest, it's so patronizing.  Then she proceeded to the guest "I must've blacked out." ...Really?  I get what she was trying to say but there are different ways of saying you messed up, like: "I must've forgot to write that down. Sorry for my misunderstanding." This is also why you repeat the order back to everyone.   I seem to think she's a bartender that's covering tables, but please, try to be warmer when you're serving people. And the hostess was on her cell phone when we left.

Very disappointed.  We ( my boyfriend and I ) walked in and the man who sat us down was very disrespectful.  We ran into an old friend so we chatted with him for 5 min and the hostess asked if he should wait and I said no you can seat me while my boyfriend continues his convo. The man insisted on waiting with an annoyed look on his face so I made my boyfriend speed it up. We got seated, our waitress got us drinks and didn't have much of a conversation which is fine. I accidentally spilled my drink which multiple waitresses witnessed and no one offered us napkins. Then our food came and my fries were really cold. I'm so sad because I usually love this red robin location.

The pretzel bites were warm and soft,  salty and tasty with warm cheese sauce. The chili cheese fries were covered in melted cheese,  sour cream and bacon. Bob wanted it not baked so much,  but I would use a fork and just enjoy! The Boca veggie burger can be substituted for the beef patty on any of the menu which opens the possibilities. And they now have a freckled lemonade cake! (Still too noisy,  but we were sitting close so it was ok tonight! )

I went at lunchtime and the place was full. The service was quick and my double tavern ghost pepper burger was DELICIOUS! A warning to the public, the water is gross nasty nasty esco tap water. Even using a lemon doesn't kill the funk. They need to get or replace their filter/purifier if they have one. I love it for nostalgia reasons and honestly they still have my favorite burgers. Endless fries are good too if you like steak fries, which is just okay so I got a side salad.
They have a worker named matt who refused to serve us because we are mexican, never gonna eat here again

mediocre food and poor service.  Went to have a burger with my daughter tonight at Red Robin and now realize it was a poor choice. To start, our server Nichole was not very personable, never asked how our food was and only offered a refill and fries when we were pretty much done. also left the empty appetizer plate on a small 2 person booth. Now for the food, the appetizer, artichoke spinach dip was was served cold in the middle, our burgers were both DONE, not medium as requested.  Because I did not feel like waiting for food to be redone, I figured I would call and speak with a manager when I got home, upon doing so and being transferred to a "manager" I explained the poor service and food situation to her she stated she would be back shortly after she talked to her manager (I thought I was talking to a manager). upon her return she offered to send a gift card as an apology and to provide them an opportunity to show they could do better. then she hung up on me, wow. I figured that was all I wanted to deal with and I would just come here and share my experience here. While I like Red Robin and have eaten at this location numerous time in the past, I'm not sure I will return. I will be taking the time to let RR know through their own web site, while letting them know about my review here.

We have been there twice, both times were not good experiences the first time the food was ok, but the Service was bad, so a few months past, and thought we like Red Robin lets give it one more time, well this time the food was horrible and the Service was even worse! They are way to busy and under staffed.That's where  the food gets cooked to quick and its sloppy or over cooked.. and you order dipping sauces that never come, and the topper we went to pay and they added a complete other meal to our bill.. Thankfully I went through the receipt...We will never GO BACK TO THAT LOCATION EVER AGAIN! :(

Service is absolutely horrible! Food is okay but compared to the service I won't be coming back. Took about 30 minutes for our waitress to come back to us after we got our food. Took even longer for her to refill our drinks and bring out more fries. You know the service is horrible when you have to wait to finish eating because you are thirsty.
Came back and this time they got it down. I understand that people get busy but with kids the time is always limited. They were on top of it and the food was great. Thanks

SO FANTASTIC Came here on 9/26/15 with a toddler, a 5 yo, 15 yo, myself, and my grandparents. The two youngest shared a kid's mac n cheese, fruit, and some of our fries. 15 yo ordered the chicken tenders and fries. I got a double tavern burger and fries, and a strawberry lemonade. Grandparents shared a chocolate milkshake with malt on the side as only grandpa likes the malt. Bbq burger and fries. The food was so amazing. No complaints. Even the kid's mac n cheese was creamy and so fantastic. Bottomless fries with their seasoning right on the table to get them flavored as much or as little as you like. Burgers so delicious and filling.  Waitress Nicole was very stiff but otherwise a very great evening with amazing food
Wait time was right on , only 30 min for a part of 4 on Saturday night. Food was good, and our server "Alexis" was very nice.

Ventured into Escondido to come to Red Robin for my free birthday burger. Restaurant was busy and we had to wait 15 minutes to be seated but overall we had a pretty good experience. When it's your birthday month, be sure to sign up for their rewards. Hey, who doesn't love a free burger? You can choose any burger you want with the exception of the 3 promotional burgers. I ordered the gourmet burger wrapped in lettuce. Lettuce was fresh, burger was juicy, toppings were on point. Steak fries come bottomless but I didn't need a refill due to being full from the burger. Husband wanted to order the jump start app which was a pick two type thing, and he opted for the cheese sticks and fried jalapeños. There is something about dipping a fried jalapeño in ranch that is just delicious!!! I HIGHLY recommended the jalapeños. Our server brought me a little sundae to enjoy with the hubby for my birthday. That of course was delicious too. We found a spot, but parking can be super rough during "rush hour" mall times. Red Robin is over by the Sears.  Definitely a good restaurant for the kids. For some reason whenever we show up at a restaurant we get asked if we need a kids menu and coloring paper. Our kid is 7 months old.. She doesn't eat restaurant food, nor can she color quite yet! Hilarious BUT the hostess proceeded to leave crayons and coloring paper on our table. Gee, thanks.  Our server was quick, attentive and super nice. My only drawback is the little iPad looking things on the table. Beware that if you click on the "games" you're actually paying $1.99 to play them. We had no clue we purchased it until our check came. Oh well, at least my dinner was free.

Food: they have a ton of different burgers to choose from here. They have a variety of bread and dipping sauces to choose from too. We ordered cheese sticks and Jalapeño coins ($7) as our appetizer. Came with about 4 cheese sticks and a large handful of jalapeños. Both were really good and I would definitely get again. Came with pizza sauce and ranch. Jalapeños were just below moderately spicy. I ordered the A1 Steakhouse burger ($11.49)and it came with fried onions, cheese, bacon and A1 seasoned beef patty. The party was average size and a little on the dry side. Flavor was good. The bun included was an onion bun and it was very moist. It held up well throughout the whole burger. Their burgers come w steak fries and they are bottomless. These are pretty decent as well and they have Red Robin seasoning at each table. They automatically serve you ranch w these fries.  Service: hostesses at the from were bland and not personable. Waiting only 15 minutes on a Sunday in October. Our server was very friendly and energetic. He was very attentive and our drinks were promptly refilled. You pay with your card by using a touchscreen device at each table. These devices also have the menu on them as well as games. Be ware because the games seem easy to start playing, but they charge you on your bill. This wasn't clear to us and we played a game and wasted $1.99.  Atmosphere: TVs all over. We had no problem watching the SNF game. They aren't the largest TVs in the restaurant section, but this is no sports bar. There are cool pictures everywhere. It is very crowded here on busy days. Great for large parties.  Parking: mall parking is not great. It is located next to Sears at the mall. Parking can be a pain.  Tip: sign up for their Red Robin Royalty for free online or at your table and you will get a free burger during the month of your birthday. This will save you $10. They also serve you an ice cream sundae for free if you are celebrating a birthday.

I love Red Robin! I wish there was one closer to me, I think this is the closest one. I love their steak fries, especially since they are bottomless, get the garlic ones! I love their burgers, I usually always get the Banzai Burger (which is what I got Friday night) I love their apps! I got the $5 short stack onion rings:) They've got a rewards program, if you buy I think 9 or 10 meals, you get a free burger! Plus birthday specials on your birthday month:)
My family and I love Red Robin!  We especially love Kahla! She is the best sever we have ever had! My son just adores her and can't wait to go back to see her!

One of my favorite places ever. This place is conveniently located inside the North County Mall close to Sears I believe. There is plenty of parking, although you might have to walk awhile but not really a big deal. The restaurant is of decent size. They have a little patio area to the side of the restaurant where you can watch people enter/exist the mall, and also shop.  Also have tables, booths an a bar area for seating. Entertainment for the kids include Arcade games, and such. Since the last time I've been here they have expanded their menu to more gourmet burgers, and other new items. They have an electronic device on all the tables which you can order your appetizers, desserts. Drinks, main food are ordered through your waiter/or waitress. If you would like to split your check or pay without having to wait on your server you can do so which I appreciate.  I came here an ordered their side salad to be brought out first since I was extremely hungry. Pretty basic- lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, croutons and your choice of dressing in a little cup. Still very good. The server brought out a red plate with napkins and silverware on top. I had the Fiery Ghost Style Tavern double. It has the ghost pepper sauce and jalapenos a few bites of this will have you wanting something refreshing to wash it down with. I usually get the Burnin love burger which has pepper jack cheese, chipotle mayonnaise, canned chipotle peppers, salsa, jalapenos, tomatoes. But I decided to try something different.  Both are very very delicious. Can't really go wrong with anything on the menu. Fries are a good amount, and you can always ask for more if you want. They have their special red robin seasoning for the fries on the table which gives it that extra flavor. The only thing I would critique this place on is the tubs they use gathering all the dishes, glasses etc once they clean off the tables. Something I don't like seeing as I'm eating my meal. Maybe put a napkin over it or pick plates up while your walking around (without the tub).

Today is Veteran's Day & I came here to enjoy the burger meal they were offering to all veterans. I have the say they were slammed with customers BUT the wait staff still took care of everybody with a smile. I was highly impressed with how they kept up with all that was going on...to include long lines & impatient people. We had the pleasure of having Veronica as our server & she was awesome to say the least. Thank you for the delicious food, the gracious hospitality & for remembering us vets!

My parents took me here a few days ago for my semi weekly "feed the poor college kid" outings and I was pretty hungry so I ordered the red's tavern burger because it was cheap and I'd already ordered a milkshake, so I didn't want to spend too much. The milkshake was insanely delicious! I got the strawberry one, and they used real strawberries and cream which made it really good! They also put a bunch of whipped cream on top and some sprinkles. When the burger came, I was kind of surprised because it seemed smaller than I expected but I wasn't that disappointed because I don't eat a ton anyways. The biggest disappointment was the secret sauce which I hardly tasted (although I got to say, red robins does have a habit of slathering on too much sauce and making the buns soggy so this was probably a good thing!) and the fact that I had maybe 10 fries on my plate. I know the fries are unlimited but it just seemed like they could have added like ten more fries and could have saved themselves from washing more dishes and looking skimpy. The one thing I did really appreciate about the fries was they no longer seem to season them so you can have them plain or put as much special seasoning on them as you like!! Personally, I really enjoyed my meal when it comes down to it. However, my stepdad ordered the roast beef sandwich expected better chunks of meat, and said his sandwich tasted just like Arby's but cheaper meat cut... Mom ordered a burger like mine and seemed to enjoy it just fine.

A very busy location. Usually able to get a table by the bar for 2 without too long of a wait. They also have a very efficient to go area. My favorite is their BBQ chicken wrap or the teriyaki chicken Hawaiian burger wrapped in lettuce instead of a bun!

I was very disappointed in their bottomless fries.  First of all, they give you a small serving of fries with your burger, and then they take forever to bring you more fries.  We asked for more fries and did not receive them until after we were finished with our burgers.  Big disappointment!!!

This was the worst experience I've ever had a Red Robin The food was cold and the service was bad When I visit other red robins everything is excellent do yourself a favor and stay away from this one And to top it off I was overcharged on the bill not pleased at all do yourself a favor and go to any other restaurant in the mall and you will be much happier
Best place to eat great burgers, awesome drinks and the best fries ever!! I've been to Red Robin all over California and Colorado and Washington. Yummy yummy in my tummy!
Ryan's a great server and kept going out of his way! Won't comment on the food or wait time...

Mom, sister and I eat here every year during our annual post-Thanksgiving trip to North County Fair. I've had salads that I was disappointed with, but sandwiches and fries are yum. I was disappointed that they didn't have just a regular Chicken Cesar Salad. Why does it always have to be fancied-up these days? Grilled romaine, sun dried tomatoes... I have no problem with those, but I was in the mood for a good old regular frill-less Cesar. I would up getting the fancy one and it was good enough, but what earned the extra stars was the chicken. I'm not exaggerating when I say that the I haven't tasted a chicken breast that had that much flavor since I was in Paris. It. Was. Awesome. And my mom had a chicken dish also and she commented on how much flavor it had. I don't know if they cook it with a chicken bouillon cube or what but it's going to be hard to eat chicken again now that I know I can get that good of a chicken breast in the U.S. I thought we'd ruined them with antibiotics and all that junk. Highly recommend the chicken.

Imagine going to a mall on Thankgiving weekend with 6 adults, 2 kids...yeah, gives me chills too.  However, it was my dad's birthday and he likes this place..so, off we went.   Lauren was our server and handled our large party with ease, even with the complete and total utter madness in the restaurant. I will admit, I do enjoy their burgers (even though they're a chain restaurant!).  I've never had a bad burger here...nor bad service for that matter. Very kid friendly, very loud place....I'm sure I'll be back...(when my parents come to visit!)
If your not hunger for a hamburger get there off menu Chicken Parmesan Pasta!! And their freckled lemonade! Saun was our server at the time, fantastic guy!

Chicken sandwich here is great, and endless fries even better  gets very packed on the weekend. I like to come on the weekdays, to avoid this. Our waiter was so rude and uninterested in what she does though.... She didn't even care, and seemed kind of mad when I asked for more fries...
Very unsatisfied, especially with the ugly bald headed manager. Never have I ever felt so belittled. Very rude man! Don't bother coming here.
Chicken sandwich was dry, our server was  great.  We had to wait 20 mins and then they called everyone at same time so then everyone is trying to get their seat. Kind of crazy.

Was taken here for dinner by friends. Not my usually choice. Most people know what this place is. I had not been in many many years and the signage excited me. As I did not remember Red Robin being a gourmet burger spot. Well it was not. Service was great,  I ordered the ghost burger with a garden salad. The salad was not fresh, and clearly made earlier and refrigerated. The burger was a disappointment. If your looking for a gourmet burger this is not the place, if your looking for basic burger and don't care so much about flavor go to McDonalds and save $5 bucks.

Always a huge fan of Red Robin burgers. The customer service for this specific restaurant was great. Our waiter was busy but still had other waiter assist us. During our meal, our waiter would consistently ask if we needed anything and refilled our drinks without us needing to ask. Thumbs up for the customer service!
Service is a hit or miss. But food is always good. Alcoholic drinks are ok at best. Cleanliness is 50/50.

I rarely go to Red Robin, probably because it's a chain and there's not too many around. They're all usually located at shopping centers or malls, but it's always been good to me. They're also usually always packed, especially during dinner time and even more hectic on weekends and holidays. Do expect anytime between 10min - 1 hour wait depending on what time or day you go and how big your party is. Service is always pretty good, except they're not so great on refilling your waters. FOOD: Towering Onion Rings® $9.00 (A tower of 13 rings tall. Served with Campfire sauce and ranch dressing) The onion rings are huge, crispy, and delicious. I love that they offer two different dipping sauces with their onion rings. Prime Chophouse $10.59 (A fire-grilled burger layered with horseradish-sautéed mushrooms, gourmet steak sauce, Provolone, Country Dijon and crispy onion straws on an onion bun) This burger is pretty delicious but the only thing I don't like is that it does get really messy. And it gets messy beacuse their burger bun gets super soft and soggy and everything starts falling apart. Other then that, it has everything that I love in one burger. Overall, a good quick place to go for burgers. They also have beer floats as well. They're okay too.
over priced...a big bun burger...wheres the beef !!! so so service and the tablets for ordering.... why not just serve myself... not impressed at all.
Amazing service! Our waitress was very friendly. My favorite burgers are the bonzai and the bacon. Bottomless fries are AWSOME! (Unlimited). Milkshakes are very good.

I've came here about 3 times already and every time it has been extremely busy. This is located in and outside of the Escondido mall meaning there are 2 entrances. After finished with shopping I like to grab a bite here. Only because the Great Khan at this location taste like crap. I've had nothing but a good experience at Red Robin. Servers are always helpful and nice. Note: THEY DO GET EXTREMELY BUSY. If you have no patience, this is probably not your place. Their onion ring tower is the best!! So crispy, warm, and delicious! This place is a bit pricey, but you do pay for what you get. They have a variety of delicious burger including a garden burger . They also have salads, wraps, and soups. You get bottomless fries with every burger! I give this place 3 starts because there could be a really loonnng wait.

I've always been a Red Robin fan. My favorite "chain restaurant" burger is the 5 Alarm Burger. Which, by the way, is no longer on the menu! So three stars for you Red Robin!!!!!!!  OK, OK that's not really the only reason I'm giving them 3 stars. I feel like the service and quality here has gone down noticeably. We've ordered food here and not really been checked on after the food arrives. Our server will just disappear. And it's happened multiple times. It's also taken forever to get our check. Another thing is the food isn't quite as good as I rememeber. The quality just seems to have dropped off. The bottomless fries & freckled lemonade are still good but the burgers in particular just don't taste as good. I can't really pinpoint what it is...maybe meat or ingredient quality, maybe the way it was cooked...i don't know. But I know it wasn't up to par. As I said before, I've always liked Red Robin, so I hope they get their act together.

I hate to give my otherwise beloved RR poor marks, but it was way less than stellar tonight. It was a fairly busy evening at 6:15 to start and drink orders were taken promptly. But our chicken Ensenada and clucks and shrimp were out in some 40 minutes, and mine must have sat since it wasn't piping hot for having all fried food.  I overheard a number of apologies to customers over apparent wrong orders and even an instance of "almost" misdelivered food. Even my bottomless Sweet potatoes fries were refilled with standard fries, but you could bet the up charge remained on the bill.  We had at least 4 different servers during our meal which normally would be ok. But it just didn't seem to work on this "off" night.

I rarely go to red robin but today was a special occasion and i have to say it still is pretty good and all but the wait was pretty bad, and when we got seated most of the forks were dirty. The only good part was the food and our waiter kahla. She is the sweetest and was looking out for her customers at all time. It will be a while before i return to red robin though.

This is a much busier Red Robin than the one we go to in UTC. I liked that we didn't have to wait around for our table and they texted us when it was ready. The waitress was very nice and they got the order right the first time. All in all it was a very good experience.

Be aware, terrible hostess in the back entrance, my family (party of 5) try to have dinner in this Restaurant yesterday at 615 pm and the hostess told us in a bitter manner that we have to wait 60 minutes for be seat, I asked for the patio table ( 5 patio tables free at that moment) and the hostess star argument with us, she was rude, smiling in a sarcastic way and unhelpful . We frequent eat in Red Robin UTC and no issues there, everything is great there. Avoid this location because rude hostess like this, could ruin your evening. Not necessary  to says , we won't come back.

Really disappointed this red Robin was making customer service to say the least. No one is there to greet you and than once you are sat no one cares it's sad. I got the a1 pepper corn burger medium rare I can imagine what it is well done cause this thing was so dry it was gross and it had no flavor the pepper corn sauce was disgusting and way to much of it the burger was a total waste for 12$ it was so gross so upset cause I normally lie red Robin

We went here for my sisters birthday. The same server us asked us twice if we needed to be seated within a time span of two minutes. Memory much? I did not like their shrimp or fish. The only think I liked was be Mac and cheese. Once seated, I told one of the waiters it was my sisters birthday and they completely forgot. Okay restaurant, but they don't listen to their customers. Would not come back here.

I ve been wanting to try this red robin location everytime I'm at the mall. So, my fiance and I decided on having our dinner date for the week last night. I was so disappointed and grossed out when I see a piece of hair on my bottomless fries. Never will I come back to this restaurant.

A little disappointed tonight.  Food was fast, but fries were old.  When we asked for fresh ones to replace the old ones, we were brought warmer old fries, not fresh fries.  Not what we normally expect from RR.

Why can't I rate 0 stars! To start our server was nice, he checked on us often but we got way over charged so be careful.  It was my step dad's bday he had chosen RR so we went, 3 adults and 1 toddler. We got 2 beers and milkshake to start and a water. The 3 adults ordered 1 burger each, my mom asked for lots of jalapeños and avocado on her burger. The server said oh you like spicy I'll bring out this sauces (I don't remember the name), he also said I'll bring out 2 more sauce. Then when I ordered my burger he said I'll put Chipotle sauce on the side. Toddler got 2 chicken nuggets and fruit. All the food was cold! Not even a little bit warm. Fast food would have been warmer. But we didn't complain.  The bill came and we have to pay on the stupid ipad. My mom wanted to pay the whole bill, she didn't want me to see the total but needed help using the ipad to pay so of course I saw how much it was. Over $80!!! But I didn't ask questions. I was thinking 3 burgers @$12ish = $36, milkshake $3.99.  I don't know how much beer was or kids meal. My mom left a $20 tip because our server was "nice". The receipt was emailed to us. After we left my mom checked her email, we got charged 4×.99 for jalapeños! She only got 6 slices! And 6×.99 for side sauces that the guy "offered" to bring. Not once did the server say they were going to cost extra. They didn't do ANYTHING for my Step Dad's bday. My mom took the survey at the end and rated them the highest  5 stars.  My mom doesn't have a lot of money but unlike most she would give a stranger her own jacket if she saw that they were cold. She is always too nice and wants to help others. For her to say she got taken advantaged from really broke my heart.  Maybe a manager would read this and call my mom to apologize.
They have a bad service and last couple of time we went somebody got sick. Is the last time I go to this Red Robin.

Terrible. They are super disorganized. The host and hostesses totally skipped over us and kept us waiting forever for a table. They admitted they screwed up. Completely ridiculous to watch how disorganized everyone and everything was. Also, it took a long time to have the waitress even acknowledge us. Food was of poor quality. Awful experience. Angry and disappointed.

Came here with my best friends to have lunch, our waiter was Ana. She was absolutely amazing, she is such a great waiter and I was extremely satisfied with the customer service I received that afternoon. She brought us everything we asked for and not only that. The food was AMAZING!! Im glad I got a chance to meet Ana, definitely will request her section next time I stop by. Thank you so much:)

Food was 4 stars! Burgers were juicy and fries were super fresh.  I'm usually not a germophobe but damn  I sat next to the kitchen and saw a waitress pick fries off a plate that she was about to serve, WTF? Staff were also in the back munching on fries... And to top it off, another waitress was picking up 2 plastic cups of ranch and her fingers accidentally dipped in the sauce, yet still served it.  I used to love this place  gonna have to drive to the one in UTC from now on
Great service, we sat near the bar. Food was very well prepared and nice atmosphere. Exactly what we wanted for a vacation dinner and drinks!
I love their shakes, and sometimes the mozzarella sticks are good.  Those have been hit or miss.

The food here is usually pretty good... So this visit was business as usual. Packed for a Thursday, so service was a bit slower. Had the chili chili burger and it was not bad. Glad they brought back the endless mac & cheese for kids that's why it gets four stars!! They came to their senses. Good

After about a year plus of not going to Red Robin I gave it a try. Service was good. Food was mediocre. It is just overpriced for the special gourmet type of burgers that come with fancier bread and slightly fancier toppings... And for a garden burger replacement of the meat it isn't really any special meat or anything so it ends up being more expensive than other fancy burger places that have better tasting veggie burgers. I still don't plan on coming here much only maybe because it is convenient and other family members might want to come here.

It's seems to me that the quality has gone down hill. So has the customer service.  Once seated our first server felt like she was in a rush. Then our second server Matt came over to take over saying she was leaving for night. But yet she was serving other tables. Even after we finished our meals.  My husband's burger had a piece of hair inside. The manager did do right by it. Overall it hasn't been consistent with the food or service.
Red Robin takes great care of their patrons. We love Melissa the Manger.  She does a great job. We will definitely return.

Wait time Friday afternoons is not fun, but if they tell you is 20min, is 20 minutes! Service was great, McKenna was our server and she was very pleasant. I ordered the pepper jack ciabatta burger, pretty good. Instead of fries i had the fruit and i was disappointed to see very ripped strawberries mixed with apples and what it looked like canned mandarins.  Therefore 4 stars.

Really disliked not only the service, but also the food and atmosphere here. Burgers are really sub par in quality, and the all you can eat fries a joke. They will keep you waiting quite a while for a refill and when you do get one, it is about 5 fries, so you can basically order another refill when they bring it to the table. Veggie burger was very generic and my husband and son didn't enjoy the beef ones any better. Very much a typical chain restaurant where no care goes into what they are doing and for what you get the prices are just too high, not worth returning.
I don't know how this place has so many good reviews it was terrible. Service was good but all the food was awful
Burger was burnt. Sent back. Brought back another, slightly less burnt burger. Not worth $15. Not coming back every again. They've let me down the last few times I've been there.
Matt whit the glass was awesome great server  May9,2016 8:16pm. If u ever stop to eat asked to sit in his  Area

Went to the mall last night with the girls to do some shopping. We were getting hungry so decided to stop and eat at Red Robin. It was around 8pm or so, so there were not too many people in there eating and we were seated quickly. We were first greeted by Lauren who was very nice. She took our drink order and stated Matt would be are waiter for the night. To our surprise Matt was so fantastic! it is really difficult to receive excellent customer service now days, but he was excellent! He was very attentive and made sure everything tasted good and we had everything we needed. This is the best service I have received at this location and the food was great! Thank you Matt!!

This place gets three stars because although I like the food, the service can be hit-an-miss. I've eaten here and gotten great service, and I eaten here and had bad service.  In the case of the bad service it was (partly) my fault. What I mean is I am diabetic and we got to Red Robin around 4:30 pm and I had literally not eaten all day. Now, I know better than to do that, but somehow it just happened. That being the case, when our waiter came to the table for the drink order I let him know the situation and that I really needed something to snack on immediately because I was sugar-crashing. So I ordered a soda and some chips and salsa.  My hope was that he would go straight to the back, grab a basket of chips/salsa and come right back.  Didn't happen. He was gone about 10+ minutes when he showed up with the diet sodas..no chips. He dropped of the drinks and said he was going to "check" on the chips/salsa. As I watched him more-or-less make his rounds to all his tables I realized he was not going anywhere near the kitchen anytime soon. Eventually, a different server showed up an about another 5+ minutes with the chips/salsa.  So, the thing is, its not really his problem that I waited to long to eat, am diabetic, and all that stuff. So I get it. At the same time though, it just kinda seems like he could've maybe been a little more understanding of the jam I got myself into and just ran to the kitchen and gotten me some chips.  Like I said, though, I HAVE gotten really good service at this place and the food is always good. So I definitely recommend it.

Always good...and who can say no to bottomless fries??  the service was friendly and they teamed up to make sure we were taken care of. The burgers are cooked to perfection. No pink inside but still juicy. That's an easy one to screw up so it's always nice to go someplace they do it right

Whenever I come to Red Robin, I always try a different burger. Never been disappointed. Love, love, love the endless fries (regular, sweet potato or garlic (Yum!)), endless rootbeer floats and freckled lemonades. My burger was delicious. We had the most amazing waitress, Antonia! She never let our drinks go below the 1/4 mark and was always there with refills on fries, etc. Great, great customer service. The couple next to us thought we were celebrities because she was taking such great care of us!

Don't believe the wait times...  30 min promise turned into a 90 min wait.  Asked the check in person and they  said it is what they just tell people.  It had no basis in fact.  Very disappointing and a huge waste of time for us all.
Our server was very nice Our food was prepared as ordered.  However, we were never offered more bottom less fries.

Bad, bad, bad.....I don't even know where to start! Our waitress was very slow. we asked for Parmesan and parsley fries we got regular fries and on top of that they were cold. I asked for my burger to be pink and they brought out well done. Also they charge you $1.99 if you use the little tablet (games) that is placed on your tables. I will not be returning.
Like coming here. Good is generally good. Love the fish and chips. Last time there. Yesterday. Service was real slow. Hard to get refills on sofa and fries.

Not my favorite place, but I had some good fried pickles. The fried pickles had some strong seasoning. I also had a milkshake. That wasn't the best. The so called "wiped cream"  wasn't (to me) didn't, taste like wiped cream at ALL! And the shake to me was a little extreme. It says it's creamy and that's what it tastes like. Basically just cream with a flavor! . When the main food came out: the Swirly Twirly Pasta came out that was the best part! It had marinara sauce on top! (My favorite sauce) The pasta was swirly and twirly! The service was amazing! They where not in your face like 24-7 or never at your table. They where very well spaced in service. The setting is warm and friendly! The people how work here are kind, nice, ect. I don't have anything bad to say about Red Robin. I don't think they are dirty or gross. Question One: Need a burger or want a burger? GO TO RED ROBIN!!! DO IT! I DARE YOU!!!

Customer Service - 4 out of 5 Food - 4 out of 5 Drink Selection - 3 out of 5 Overall we had a pleasant lunch at Red Robin, however there were a few areas which let it down. The drinks we ordered weren't what arrived, although quickly sorted out by our extremely professional and personal waitress. The bottomless fries are a little bit of a con. You get about twenty 'thick cut' fries per portion, which after your first few bites leave you instantly needing to order more fries. The signs outside show a wide selection of draft beers, although that is not always the case when you're inside the restaurant. On the whole however the food was enjoyable and the waitress really made us feel comfortable and looked after the whole time. If we are in the area again there's a good chance we will come back.

Corporate policies are killing this place. The menu says the Chili-chili cheeseburger is served "open-faced with a generous helping of chili and cheese", but what you ACTUALLY get is a closed face burger with just enough chili for you to know it's there. This place does a lot of business, and chili is pretty cheap. This is a perfect example of a stupid management trying to save money the WRONG way.  My wife ordered a signature drink, the "Sand in your Shorts". She had it before, and liked it. It is vodka and triple sec and chambourd with orange and cranberry juice and, I think, a touch of grenadine (something like that, at least.  This time, she gets a screwdriver with a little chambourd, MAYBE! And that drink took 15 minutes! Sorry to split hairs, but if you charge 8 bucks for a drink, make sure your bartender knows how to make it! At least hire bartenders who know "if you can't think, make it pink!"  Our kids meals suddenly start coming with 6 fries. It doesn't even LOOK like they're trying! I'm sick of enduring sub-standard burgers for the sake of pleasing kids who only like the atmosphere, just so I can come away $75 lighter and unsatisfied. This has gone on long enough. My next trip should yield a free meal, but I don't even think I want it. We come here 3 times a month, but I'm tired of overlooking substandard experience for such a high price.  We're members of their rewards program. They can't pretend we're just jerks looking to score free stuff or people who just had one bad experience. This is over a year of me hoping they just screwed up once! Whoever is managing this high-volume location just sucks. That's it...they SUCK! And I'm done giving them chances. I'm now former customer, and my kids will have to find someone else to serve them generic Sysco chicken strips.  As proof they don't give a crap about your experience, I got no response from corporate for my feedback. I guess a few thousand dollars of revenue from one family doesn't count for sh*t! Um, apparently my review needs to be 'finished', so I will finish by saying that Red Robin is FINISHED as far as I am concerned!

Worst experience  ever don't  recommend... after a long day at the park a couple of friends decided to come over to this location got there at 930pm do under restaurant closes at 10pm. But we felt a bad welcome we got placed near the kitchen and the cooks kept making comments  such as close down no more people it made us uncomfortable, but we were very hungry,waiter was very nice but it still felt after we got our food that we were being rushed. No one should fill this way at a food restaurant...if we knew we would get treated that way they should of just said they are closed or said to go only .... Don't like your job quit  because situations like this are going to happen..will never come back

Our server Jenne was excelent and very attentive. I have food allergiea so she really took her time to accomidate me. She even replaced my fries that were not even warm. Food qas great too. Definitely will return. Thank you
Service is so good :) they made a mistake on my burger but replaced it right away. Drinks, they refill it all the time. They make sure everything is taken care of.

They are always busy so it's hit or miss on wait times. We arrived at 5pm last night and they were busy, but the wait was only 5 minutes.  We ordered our drinks and we got them quick. We then ordered appetizers and those were at the table fast and tasted great also. Can't go wrong with the onion ring stack!  We also ordered the bar wings and chips and the bone in wings were delicious. Just crispy enough and lightly spicy.  My only complaint was the new limited time stuffed crab burger. It was not good. I love seafood but this was bland and soggy. The burning love was delicious. I'm always wary when I try something new and I should have followed my instinct on this one.  I love that the staff has each other's back. The waitress had back up with bringing out all the food, taking more drink orders and even bringing us another menu when a drink spilled. The staff is friendly and attentive, even when slammed.  We will come again!

Decent service overall. Staff was generally friendly or helpful. The food was not so great. The burger was tasteless and part of it overdone like the 'jalapeño coins' which seemed burnt . Wouldn't recommend but not the worst. Rather go to Wendy's lol

Service and atmosphere was good but the food was nothing like I remember from years ago. The presentation was lacking and the quality of the ingredients was mediocre.  Sweet potato fries and regular fries were served at room temperature (twice). The food just didn't warrant what we paid for the meal.

I can't believe I have never written a review for Red Robin. We love coming here, when we come to this mall. Food is yummy. Service is good. And so far I have never had to wait for a table. This trip was super busy (fri night). But still was taken right in. Looks like they are expanding too. Good for them. Great job. We will be back.

Always great service with Tania and Taylor.  We  do a take out  here almost every week for dinner and movie night.  The food is always correct, but sometimes the fries are cold or not cooked.   The nice thing is sometimes when we do have issues the management steps up and takes care of me the next time.   Issues do happen, as they do everywhere, but they are concerned and management corrects the problem.  I hate the fact that people do bad reviews for one or more problems when in fact things/places/people are not perfect.   Do they work with you, comp you, or fix the problem? If so, the place deserves a better star then a 1.  So, that is why I am giving them a 5.  The people make this place a hit!!

I have been going to Red Robin for over ten years. I've always enjoyed the food and atmosphere. There is a great variety of burgers and the 'bottomless' fries have consistently made us happy.  Unfortunately, I am no longer a happy customer. For ten or more years, I've always - ALWAYS - ordered grilled onions, and have been told each time that they were available for no charge. Today I came in to the Escondido location for my usual order - Sautéed 'Shroom Burger with grilled onions. I was told there would be an extra charge for the onions. I asked if this was a new policy, and the server told me that is how it has always been. (I'm 100% sure I've been coming here longer than she has worked here.) She had the manager, Randy, come over to discuss it with me. He told me I should've been charged all along, and implied that I (as well as the hundreds of servers from whom I've ordered my burgers) have been doing something wrong. I tried to tell him I had never tried to 'cheat the system' or 'get free stuff' when I shouldn't have. I truly felt he was close to asking me to reimburse them for the (no longer) "free" onions. Had he simply said, "I don't know; it's possible that it's a new policy" - I wouldn't have been upset. Instead, he made me feel guilty.  Additionally, we asked twice for the standard basket of fries to be delivered before our food, and didn't receive it at all (until we asked two MORE times AFTER our food had already been delivered.) Instead we each were given about nine or ten small fries with our food. Really? I don't know how many thousands of $$s my large family has spent here over the years - but this will not be my go-to burger restaurant anymore.   I'm sad. :-(
They always have great service and I'm never disappointed. My server/bar tender "page" was great and hot :-D

Waited 1-1/2 hours with four hungry children.  The wait was quoted as a 30 minute wait.  Checked with hostess three times told up next and very soon and then that all the six tops people were just not leaving. When they seated another large party before us I checked again and was told we sent you a text message your table was ready, we are sitting not more than two feet from hostess with a crying two year old, I had spoken to both of them, and they sent a text!  Gave our table away!    We normally would have left, but loading up four kids and starting over on a Saturday nite 6pm was just not an option at that point. Wish we had.. The worst hamburger I ever had the meat looked like it was cooked in microwave, nearly had tan color, no taste, bun was soggy! Didn't eat two bites.  Thank goodness for fries and onion rings.  Our server was totally swamped, very apologetic, forgot the babies order, by the time we saw him again baby had eaten a lot of fries, no point in reordering it, one kid ate half Mac n cheese then was on toilet the rest of meal.  The other one ate one piece of cheese pizza, kept saying it tasted nasty...? She started throwing up at 10pm and it only lasted 24 hrs.  Was it the food? Can't say for sure but the quality was awful. This was just a bad event and doubt we will go to this red robin again.  But I do know of one in Fullerton, Orange County that has always been good! So next time I'm near Disneyland that's where we will go.

I used to go to Red Robin in Temecula often and always enjoyed it.  I moved to Oceanside and haven't been to one in years.  So we drove to Escondido and arrived at a nearly empty restaurant.  There wasn't even a hostess.  Eventually the 4 of us were sat at a very small booth with an extremely sticky floor.  Our server was very nice, got us our drinks and said he would bring out some fries for us to eat while we waited for our food.  What a brought was about 10 cold fries with 2 cups of ranch for four people to share.  Those were gone in a minute or two and the manager brought us another (no more ranch though).  The food took longer than expected, especially since there were not many customers.  The burgers were fine, but again no more ranch.  I am not sure if it is this location or Red Robin has changed, but doubt I will go back to find out.

Service... fine... food... good... environment... pleasant only complaints would have to be the time it took to get our order taken and then again the time it took to get out our orders to our table.I understand it was a busy day but when the table next to us who arrived well after us received their orders (a lot bigger and a lot more people) before our that's when we started to think we should have gone somewhere else. Overall good food great server but not a place you'd want to go if you're really hungry and want it fast.
Their milkshakes are to die for and have excellent service! The people there are super nice and helpful. Their burgers are the best and leave you satisfied every time.

Told the manager that the bathroom nerds toilet paper ,she just egnore us and walked out of the bathroom. If this is how the manager acts , I can only imagine how the staff reacts to this level of management  Red Robin needs to retrain this manager

Free burger on your birthday if you sign up via email in advance!  Had the A1 burger and hubby had the bruschetta chicken sandwich and both were delicious. Service was good, and wait times for food were decent.  I'd return. Especially for those bottomless fries!

We came here on a random Thursday evening and it was pretty busy. We were received well and seated right away as there was plenty of seating still available. The staff seemed nice and the restaurant was fairly clean. The menu is extensive with plenty of choices for beers and burger. Our server was really and courteous. I am avoiding red meets so she recommend a chicken sandwich, even though I was reluctant, I went this her advice and much to my surprise the sandwich was very good!  It was their Bruschetta Chicken sandwitch. It was very juicy and flavorful and I might actual get the same sandwich next time. I ordered a blue moon beer which was served in a nice glass at the right temp. The evening went very well as enjoyed food and conversation! Please eat here and try their Bruschetta sandwich..

Food sucked...will not go back. My parents used to love to go to Red Robin.  I remembered that the fries were good.  Wait service was fine. The look of the restaurant was fine.  My husband and I decided to share something to see if we liked the food.  It was some kind of fried fish with fries.  Fries were mushy, fish was tasteless.

Haven't been to a Red Robin in years; however hearing that there was a vegan option and I was in the area, I had to try it! Service was okay- drinks came out on time, we were checked on to make sure we had what we needed, and they were able to answer questions.  The fries were delicious with the smokey seasoning offered at the table and a little ketchup. The best part is when you get done, you get free refills- BOTTOMLESS FRIES! The vegan burger itself, which consisted of a boca patty (there's a vegetarian version as well that contains eggs) was pretty bland and seemed over cooked.  As a vegan, the only toppings we could enjoy with the burger were ketchup, mustard and barbecue sauce. Although these made it edible, it was still pretty blah. I appreciate them having a vegan option though- we just needed more flavor. I actually ordered jalapeños but never got them with my burger. That might have helped with the flavor. Come to think about it, I should have asked for avocado! Oh well!  Anyway, the fries are amazingly good if nothing else. :)

It's Red Robin. You should know what to expect before walking in. I happen to be a big fan of the chain. They do burgers, a few salads, and various sandwiches. This location inside the mall is pretty good. I was in with the family for lunch last week as we were craving their burgers, and we were not disappointed.  I had the "Burning Love" burger, the Hubs had the "Royal" burger, and the Wee One had kids meatballs with marinara. Everything was delicious. Our burgers were enormous and juicy, our bottomless fries were hot and crispy, and our cocktails (I had an Absolutely Absolute lemonade) were perfect.  Our server was super sweet and very fast and efficient. So we had an overall great experience. I will be returning as soon as I'm craving another burger.

After a much needed remodeling, they musta forgot to remodel the menu. Red Robin is a place for families. They have a robust kids menu with many options but I feel the adult menu is just average. I go here because they do a good job dropping fries at the table as soon as you order. They're also pretty quick with the refills so everyone is occupied and having a good time. In the end everyone is happy, which is a big positive after shopping at the mall for an hour with kids.  - They seemed to have dropped in quality over the years.  - You can request to sub out the gross Iceberg with Romaine on your burger. - The Kids Pizza was perfectly cut into child size pieces, very cheesy, and a kid friendly sauce.
The bartender/server Rachael was so on point with her customer service & and the BLTA croissant was AMAZING! Full 5 stars & a big thumbs up!

They just newly remodeled.  There's a larger bar area for the 21 and older crowd and the rest of the restaurant.  Not much in the menu has changed besides a few small additions and promotions.  Happy hour is pretty good because some apps are half off and some beer pitchers are cheap (mostly the non-craft beer anyway).   Last the fiance and I went here I got the Banzai salad with a freckled lemonade, and fiance got a double-something with sculpin.  The salad was actually quite filling, comes with two garlic bread slices, and is basically like the burger without the beef patty--instead you get grilled chicken slices.  Pretty light the way I like it and I came out satisfied.   They also have a new birthday song...or at least it has been that long of a time where the song I overheard sounded completely different than before.  Haha.  Service was okay.  Drinks came on time, we were checked on from time to time but one of our bottomless fries refill never made it to the table.  Luckily we had a good server and she went right to the kitchen to put in the order.  It can get busy but luckily there are two entrances (one inside the mall and the other from the outside) with plenty of seating by the waiting area.

I haven't been here in awhile, but since the last time, yes they have remodeled/expanded and the menu is a little different, but for the better. Service was alright, the waitress was friendly and attentive, but since it was busy it wouldn't be the the best, but that's fine. To start we ordered the onion rings (short stack), which turned out to be pretty good. The batter is extremely crispy, but it wasn't burnt, but was a bit oily. The burger was a little pink on the inside, but since I didn't eat that it wasn't a big deal to me. I tried the pub mac 'n cheese, and it was fine, it was cheesy, but the noodles a little too tender. I myself mainly ate the chips & queso (I asked for no chili), and it was standard. It was a lot of cheese for one person to eat, but I wasn't able to finish all of it even though I love nacho type cheese. The only issue with the queso was that parts of it were not hot, it was lukewarm. Red Robin is an okay place for decent American food.

I have been visiting different Red Robin restaurants for several years and have never had a bad experience. Their food is not fantastic, but I always know what to expect when I dine-in at one. Consequently, I have never been disappointed - until today.  While shopping around the Westfield Mall, I decided to grab dinner at Red Robin and walked over to the open bar seating after being addressed to do so by a hostess. We shuffled through tables to find one that was clean (although the bar area was nearly empty). We seated ourselves by swapping out the dirty chairs at our clean table with some other chairs that were not being used. There were three women behind the bar that were conversing with each other and seemingly had no sense of urgency to clean the 4/5 tables that were dirty or to even bring us a menu.  The combination of dirty tables, chairs with crumbs and ketchup on them, and waiting on someone to serve us, bring us a menu or even give a greeting for over ten minutes just made that experience in its entirety a complete disaster. I was extremely dissatisfied with my visit and I will not be returning to this location.

Crowded and bustling with a definitely upbeat environment.  Not a place to go for an intimate meal but definitely a place to comfortably eat way-too-many fries with a way-too-messy burger.  Good turnover so not much of a wait for a table.  Good service and can pay from the little machines on your table so can expedite leaving when in a rush.

I'm giving this 3 stars only because my meal was free for my birthday. I ordered the Burning Love Burger minus the salsa and a sangria. The sangria was garbage compared to the delicious one I enjoyed at El Torito just days before where I actually got a buzz! Minus one star.  The burger was pretty good. Not super spicy. I actually enjoyed the jalapeno they serve with it.  Here's where they went downhill. The service! By far the worst I've ever had at any restaurant. Once my food was delivered that was it. I was sitting at the bar and I could tell they were busy. I wanted a knife to cut my burger but no one came. I wanted ranch for the fries but no one came. By the time I nearly finished my burger I was finally asked how everything was and had the opportunity to ask for a side of ranch. The ranch came I finished my meal and sat as sauce ran down my fingers because there were no napkins. I had to ask twice!  With all the places there are to dine I won't be coming back here until probably my next birthday.

This was the first time I've been to Red Robin in years and I was not disappointed! Our server Matt was really great about refilling our drinks, which has been an issue the last few restaurants I've been to. The freckled lemonade and raspberry limeade are wonderful btw! The food came out fast considering how busy it was. My hamburger was cooked how I asked and tasted great. The priced aren't too bad and they have a really cool rewards program so you can earn free food. We will definitely be returning for future visits.

Came with a few friends for a little late dinner, only about 12 people in the whole place.  Sat for close to 15 minutes before our server even came by, then we placed our drink order and asked if ok to just give our order as well since we knew what we wanted by this point.  Fast forward after over 30 minutes and actually walking to the drink station to refill my own drink, we finally got our food.  At least the plates were hot (food was not).   This is sad because I usually love coming to this restaurant, but this visit has probably steered me away from coming back ever again.  If I do try another Red Robin it won't be for a very long time, and never will be this location again. 2 stars because the place was actually clean.

Ok food and service were great but one big issue for me.... They gave my 10 year old a kids menu with the games on the back with a set of crayons. No problem until my son looked at me and said the entire thing is in Spanish? I looked at it and the menu on the opposite side was in English but the other side was entirely in Spanish. I asked the waitress if she could give us another as he wanted to do the games while we waited. I was told these are the only ones we have. I think here is another business trying so hard to be politically correct without anybody asking them to. Show me where the thousands of complaints came in demanding that they offer a Spanish game section on their menu??? It never happened. I can care less if they offer a menu in every language of every patron but when you run a restaurant  in a country were the majority of the country speaks English the menu should be in English. Another Co catering to 20% of the population and ignoring the other 80%. The best part is that 20% also has never demanded an all Spanish menu. At least offer the menu with the direction written in both languages. What next waitresses that only speak Greek? How about only accept African money. Ridiculous and stop trying to fix what nobody thinks is broken.  Look at us we are so politically correct although nobody has asked for it.
This place is usually a good stand by.. However today it was horrific! The waitress never refilled our drinks, forgot our fries and it took over 2 hours to get in and out.
Went here for a drink with some friends and thought it was alright overall. The service was good and I got a margarita that just wasn't the best.

I came here for dinner. We got seated right away at a table. As we got seated, the waiter got our drink orders. I got a Diet Coke. I had a free burger for my birthday so I got the royal Red Robin which had a over easy egg in the burger along with bacon, cheese, lettuce and tomato. It came with refillable fries.  We waited forever for our food to come out. The waiter asked how I wanted my burger. I told him I didn't want to see any pink but when I took a bite, I saw pink which grossed me out. I only ate half of my burger and finished my fries. I literally got grossed out. After eating, I asked for a refill on my Diet Coke. They don't automatically bring you another drink once they see your glass is empty. We asked for a couple of boxes and a bag. That took forever as well. Service was slow. I'm truly disappointed in this location. The location in Plaza Bonita is way faster and more attentive to their customers.  I don't think I will return to this location. Service was slow on a Sunday night. Maybe because there was football on the television. I was highly disappointed.

If you have not been to this Red Robin in some time come back and see all the changes!  The bar area used to be small but has totally expanded and you can look out into the mall now.  This also gave more table space to the main restaurant!  We opted to eat in the bar area and skip the 20 minute wait on a Saturday night.  I orderer the burning Love burger and it arrived on time. It's quite an awesome looking burger with that chili up in top of the bun!  It was hot and spiced as advertised !  Loved the burnin Love !   The all you can eat bottomless fries however arrived in a small ring that was barely full.  I immediately ordered more :). They arrived quickly with twice as much !  I would go back for sure.  Also if you sign up for the club you get a free burger on your birthday! Woot!

Can't say how much I dislike this trend for restaurants to put the annoying screens at each table. Can we say tacky?? Not to mention a total nightmare for parents who don't want their kids begging to play on a screen the whole meal.  Better yet, our Prime Rib Dip was nothing more than weird, soft bread with fatty cuts of beef in it. The chocolate malted milkshake was mediocre, and the kids meal mac n cheese was a strange orange color (and my normally unpicky eater said it tasted like plastic...ew). The french fries were the only food we wanted to eat that day. I will say that our waitress was very sweet and on task.  In general though, not a fan.

This place was great. It was my first time.. I drove from carlsbad with a co worker after work because she kept telling me that I wouldn't regret it. Sure enough my food was delicious.  The chicken was perfect. My co workers had a burger and it looked amazing! We also had onion rings for appetizers... they were perfect! Our waiter was attentive and friendly. Not too pushy or awkward. He was however always on top of it. We entered from the inside of the mall itself and weren't greeted until about 10 minutes after we arrived.  I noticed they have two entrances so maybe because it was so busy they had a hard time managing both? I don't know but maybe that would be my only criticism ... other than that .. for a rainy Monday I was very impressed to see how busy they were. I didn't mind the drive ... it was definitely worth it!

First and foremost, the hostess was a doll and so sweet! Loved the Boca burger options! Wish they had the char broiled one :/ BUT it was still delicious! Our waitress Lauren was friendly, fast and efficient. Do yourself a favor and request her, she actually made sure our food was correct( by repeating our order back to us) and checked on us often. She had great knowledge of the menu and didn't get frustrated with my many questions. She truly made my first time, a time to remember! Thanks Lauren! See you soon.

I stopped going to this location and any other Red Robin bc I can't get a hot meal.  The $12 burger always arrive at the table lukewarm with a cold bun... Even when I  complain.. I get another lukewarm burger. If I wanted a cold sandwich... I would order a BLT or a salad.  Same with the fries.  Usually soggy.   A lousy In&Out burger and fries is sometimes more satisfying than here and cheaper .   Or I'll stick to the old standby... Save money and make it at home.  It really is not that hard.

I just finished a great massage and was hungry. We decided to stop at the Red Robbins in the mall next to the massage place.  We walked in and they looked busy this particular Saturday. It took a while to be seated and when we finally sat down, we noticed a lot of open seating. It seemed like the guests were made to wait unnecessarily in the waiting area to give the illusion that the place was busy. Either they were short handed or just disorganized.  Our server was very pleasant and friendly. We ordered burgers, fries, and shakes. Our drinks came out rather quickly and we were happy. The food came out fresh and tasty so that was a plus.  Overall, my experience was ok and I would be willing to return to try other dishes on the menu

This is the closest location around North county, and they have recently remodeled. The service is fast and friendly. It always seems to be crowded. Their are plenty of menu options and at least 20 burger options alone. The to go containers are great and the food tastes good but the burgers and fries do not travel well and seem to dry out on the drive home. Check your to go order before you go, they sometimes leave items out or give you the wrong items. Join the royalty club and buy 9 or 10 burgers and get 1 free, and I think 1 free one on your birthday too. They offer bottomless fries for dine in but if you ask for some extra with the to go orders they will usually give you extra.

Was in north county and was craving their bottomless French fries. This was the only Red Robin I can think of in the area. The restaurant is located by Sears at the north county mall in Escondido. It's a great place for lunch or dinner. I ordered a double cheeseburger ($6.99) which came with bottomless French fries. After you finish your first basket of fries they will bring out another basket of fries for you. Our server was great, she kept asking if everything was ok and kept up with refills on our drinks. Overall it's a great place for a good burger and some fries. Will be returning to a Red Robin soon.
We've been here twice and absolutely love it! We always have great service and great food. We drive from Oceanside to come here!! It's amazing!
