Debated what to rate them.  The food is good, but the pickup food was cold & the staff handled the whole order painfully. :( Called in a pickup order.  Explained to the guy who answered the phone several times I had TWO separate orders.  Gave him the 1st order.  Then said this is the 2nd order which is separate.  He kept talking over me the whole time making the call exasperating and taking a longer time then needed. Go pick it up and it's all on one order.  Told the girl who was ringing us up to separate it like I asked, since one order was for my brother.  She bumbled trying to figure it out taking forever until I finally said never mind! The takeout food was just sitting on a table and not under warmers like some places do, so it was already lukewarm from the start. My wife loves their BQ whiskey chicken sandwich, great steak fries & onion rings that have a really good dipping sauce. Service zero stars, food was only OK 2 stars.

I am a big fan of Red Robin, even though I've been to many other awesome burger joints throughout San Diego and all over the US. Red Robin is one of those places that somehow gets their burgers to look almost exactly as they are pictured on the menu. I feel like you always get what you order at Red Robin, and that is exactly what happened during our last visit.  They recently expanded the dining room to include more seating, and there is an actual bar area now. The bar is all the way towards the back of the restaurant, so the easiest way to get there is to go in the mall entrance (to the left of the RR entrance) and follow it around until you see the inside mall entrance. We went on a Saturday night, around 6:30 pm, and the wait time was about 30-45 mins. We went around to the bar area, and there were quite a few open seats so we ate in the bar. No wait and full menu. They also have the menu tablets at the table, so you can call the server as soon as you sit down. You can also split your check up and pay on as many credit cards as you want on the tablet, so you don't have to annoy the server by asking him/her to do it for you.    I can't remember a time that I have been disappointed with my order here, because it is always done the way I ask for it. I ordered the Burnin' Love Burger and hubby ordered the Royal Red Robin Burger, and both burgers were perfectly done. One of us ordered the fries as the side and the other ordered the onion rings. Both of our burgers came out perfect. The fries were great as usual, and the onion rings are pretty darn tasty as well. We often order the tower of onion rings, which is always delicious, but we decided to just stick to ordering it as a side for the burger. Just so you know, the onion rings are not bottomless and you really only get about 4-5 small to medium sized onion rings if you order them as the side to your burger.  TIP: If you plan on ordering a burger with bottomless fries, inform the waiter you are doing this in the beginning and ask them if they can get you started on your bottomless fries. I usually order our drinks and then let the waiter know that we want fries too. It is a great appetizer and money saver, since you can have as many fries (they're bottomless) as you want! They also have a lot of sauces to choose from as well.

Had the greatest experience at the Red Robin today, celebrating my granddaughters 13th birthday, it's our tradition, and she chooses this restaurant every year.  Our amazing server, CRYSTAL, was attentive, kind and efficient, making my granddaughter feel so special.  She kept checking back, refilling drinks, offering fries and the birthday sundae, just wonderful service.  We were there before lunch, served and seated promptly, and the food was hot, fresh and delicious.  KUDOS to CRYSTAL, you are a "super-server"

It's been a long time since we went to Red Robin.  Previously we would visit the Del Mar location (no longer there) many years ago.  We had some gift cards, so we decided to go to the Escondido location (in the mall, next to Sears).  We really enjoyed our meal and the all you can eat french fries.  I had the the Whisky River burger, it was absolutely amazing.  The fries were cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  My wife and son really enjoyed the food as well.  Kit (our server) was very nice as well.  We plan to go back soon in hopes it will be just as good.
LOVE THIS PLACE..... food is amazing...favorite is the Chrispy chicken tender salad..... good place to come for any occasion:) our server Phil was AMAZING!!!!

I had a good experience at Red Robin. I have been to Red Robin on and off for years. This North County location was nice. Their was a wait in the front so we walked back to the bar area and it was wide open and actually quieter than the restaurant area. This was a Thursday night at 7 and their was a wait. Pretty good sign.  Customer service was great as expected. They actually messed up my order by giving me the wrong side but once I mentioned it they brought me my requested side and the other one. No questions asked.  Food was good. I had the bruschetta chicken. It was very tender and the bread was perfect. Sweet potato fries were so so. They are thin so you need to eat them quick. My boy got a the whiskey River burger. Always a favorite and classic go to Burger. Good food, service and prices.

Crystal was our server. She had a great personality and made us feel very comfortable. We ordered our food and the french fries were cold and still raw in the middle.  We explain that to crystal she immediately went and got us a new order of fries that were perfect and delicious. This experience was much better than the last experience we've had there. We will come back and hopefully we will be in crystal section again.

***Stellar Customer Service*** Placed an order for pick up tonight for a few burgers. When I got home, I realized the food received was for salads. Phoned Red Robin to report the mix up. When we arrived to pick up our order, Travis (Manager), not only replaced our food with a full refund but also gave me a gift card for the inconvenience. This is phenomenal service. Sure it was an inconvenience to have to return to the restaurant to get my correct order but when this has happened at other restaurants, the experience is not this pleasant. I feel like Travis went above and beyond. We will for sure keep coming back to Red Robin with service like this. Thank you Travis! You are the epitome of customer service.  P.S. The food was delicious!  Posted on behalf of Edgar H.

We were looking forward to a good tasting dinner, unfortunately it started wrong from the time they seated us. My husband in handicapped and uses an electric scooter. We were taken from the front of the restaurant to about as far away as you could get from the door to an outside table inside the mall. We walked past several empty tables and were maneuvered through aisles and a door. My husband asked to be placed inside the restaurant. The man seating us said he'd have to go look at his iPad...he never returned. I was ready to leave but husband wanted to stay as getting out of the restaurant was going to be a challenge. I finally had to track our waitress down to ask her could we please have some water. Husbands meal of Mac 'n cheese was declared good. My cob salad was so-so. Our waitress tried but it was a terrible place to be seated and a couple of bathroom trips were very difficult. Before we left they staff set up a long table for a big party that blocked the door. 4 people at that table had to get up, move their chairs and a table so we could exit. How to have a pleasant evening out turned into a meal you couldn't wait for to be over.  If you don't want to chance how you'll be treated for so-so food and spend your hard earned money to be miserable. Try Red Robin in Escondido.

I have never had an issue when I eat here. Service is always prompt and staff is always kind. I remember ordering a veggie burger once and the patty was slightly cold, they refunded my food and made me a while new burger. I ordered the shroom burger with a veggie patty and it has melted swiss cheese on it. Delicious. Bottomless fries are a highlight and the waiters always hook it up with ranch. We ordered the fried mozzarella sticks which were perfectly crispy. Mmm. I love that they have Bottomless drinks here. They have root beer floats as one. Dangerous, but I settled for a freckled strawberry lemonade. Careful, it is very sweet.  I love this place.
Don't go to Red Robin they have slow service nice people but not good service and I don't even think they cooked our food I waited almost half an hour!
Burgers look smaller, less fries served, burgers dont have a real good taste it taste like a regular burger i can cook at home

We called in an order for pick up; I'd ordered just a cheeseburger with lettuce and pickles, nothing else, got the food and went home, they'd given me the full burger, everything on it, checked with the other person to see if I'd grab the wrong one but he had gotten a bacon burger, I didn't end up eating it because I didn't like nearly everything that was on it! Including the sauce they'd put on it, can't really pick that off...That was my first (and last) experience at Red Robin.

My boyfriend and I recently ate at Red Robin and didn't not have a great experience. The wait for seating was so-so. It seemed busy, and it was. We got seated in a crowded area next to a big group that's seated on one side and then a table for 2 on the other side. It was very uncomfortable, it felt like the table with the 2 were a part of our table. I could barely get out of my seat through both sides. That's how close they were. I asked if we could be moved and fortunately they were nice enough to moves us to a booth.  As far as service, the waiter we got was nice, but he seemed too busy for us. We always had to flag him down for something. If I didn't know any better, I'd say he was the only waiter there that day. We didn't have any utensil for the whole visit, got napkins half way through eating our food, and he didn't ask us for refills on our drinks either. My food order was wrong, I got a BLT crossaint sandwich. Ordered the sandwich with no bacon and added cheese to my sandwich. My order came with bacon, turkey slices, lettuce and mayo. No Tomato, and no cheese...and again had to find an opportunity to get a hold of our waiter.  Never had a bad experience here, but as they were trying to cram as much people in that day, service and the food failed big time. We will not be coming back.

My mom and I brought my kids here today for lunch - I haven't had Red Robin in a while, and now I wonder why we don't go there more often! The food was tasty and they had great low price options on the menu. We had the burgers/fries for $6.99 each, and my kids had the chicken strips and mac and cheese from the kids menu. It all tasted fresh; I find that usually when I go out to eat, it's hard to order chicken strips that aren't burnt and super crispy, where they're almost all breading, to the point where they're inedible. Here, they were juicy, and you could actually taste the chicken! And the bottomless fries, who doesn't love that?! They had multiple fruit choices as a side for my kids, they had the tangerine slices. I was actually really impressed with my entire experience. Our server was personable, and she even suggested that my kids grab a balloon on the way out, which we would have had no idea they were there if she didn't offer; I thought that was nice of her (sometimes it's the little things!). We received our food in a timely manner. Overall, we enjoyed our lunch here and I'll definitely be back.
I've been here 3 times and love it. The last time the wife and I went we took our 7 year old grand daughter and feasted on tons of appetizers. Great service considering how busy the staff was.

The food is pretty tasty here, it's the service that needs some work. Walking in, the hostess led us to our booth, where we passed by a puddle of water all over the floor. No caution signs anywhere, very safe! We sat down and noticed how slow it was in the place. Took about 10 minutes until a guy came by to take our drink order and an additional 10 minutes until we got our drinks. 20 minutes passed by, our order still hasn't been taken. Finally our waiter comes by. We ordered wings, a Mac and cheese burger and a short stack of onion rings. The onion rings were crispy and piping hot. The wings, cold, but great flavor and delicious. The burger was really yummy and hit the spot. It took very long to get the bill as well, again, service is an issue here. Don't expect to be out of here quick.

NCF location is the main one we go to. I'm not a big meat eater, but on occasion I enjoy a turkey burger. This one is my favorite location because the carpool lane drops us off right in the parking lot of NCF. The other locations (UTC and Temecula), parking is more of a hassle. The food itself is decent for a burger franchise and they have a generous rewards program, where every 10th burger/entree/salad purchase results in you getting a free one on your next visit. Plus a free birthday month burger/salad too. The burgers come with unlimited salad (or fries) and I always substitute iceberg for spring greens and get an additional serving. The main reason for the 5 star review is because of our favorite waitress, Suzy. We've been her customers for a few years now and make it a point to sit in her section every time. The only downside is their main bathroom is always trashed. But they have private bathrooms by the bar area (which also get dirty during busy times). It also can get really crowded during peak dining times. Also, did a takeout which we were told would take 10 minutes and it took half an hour. So I think overall 4.5 is a fair assessment.
Worst happy hour ,it sucks I honestly think they forgot to add liquor to my margarita‍.Their burgers are ok a bit pricy for just a burger and a small portion of fries

Excellent service, good food. Thoroughly enjoyed the ambience celebrating a birthday. Servers were very attentive and friendly. Convenient location in NC Fair mall. Fun, lively place for good eats w/ family and friends.

First time here and pretty impressed with the food. We sat in the bar area and got a couple burgers. The server was for the most part, attentive and friendly. It started to get crowded around lunch time so keep that in mind. Reasonably priced - 2x meals with sodas came out to about $35.  Good place to slide into and grab a quick bite to eat before taking on the mall. Would recommend this place to friends looking for a burger in the area.

I usually love Red Robin so it is disheartening to have to write such a low review. I ordered a few things from GrubHub to be delivered. Not only did my order take over an hour and a half to be delivered (which I understand could be due to a number of reasons) but my order was missing the fries - which was my main reason for ordering Red Robin. (The steak fries with their seasoning is to die for - BTW) I also asked for Thousand Island on my burger. Now, I understand not loading the burger up with dressing, but a think I should've be given more than the little "dot" I had on my sandwich. Also, our appetizer was just half-heartedly thrown into a container that was either too big or we didn't receive a full order. The last time I ordered from this establishment, we did not receive the extra condiments we had paid for. With this being the second offense, we will be reconsidering ordering from Red Robin again unless we can stop by in person.

The booth seating was designed for a Hobbit or dwarf. I'm a large framed guy ( I asked to be seated at a table but they denied my request due to the fact that they had no waitress covering that area of the dining room. Poor parking situation make this location a pit stop of convenience rather than going out of your way to visit.

Delicious burgers, attentive servers, reasonably priced liquor and beer, bottomless fries with their great ranch dressing- what's not to like?  The reason this is not a 5-star is because they put the wrong kind of cheese on my burger and had to wait (not too long) to have them re-make it. The Tavern Burgers are delicious and where else can you get a burger and fries for $6.99? Now that's a bargain that keeps me coming back!

Great service and a fantastic Bloody Mary! Oh and the food was good too!  Split a burger and got soups on the side. I had the chili. Unfortunately it was just warm. And not my favorite chili. The onion ring tower was great though.

We were hopeful with the new construction that they would install sound absorbing materials in this restaurant - but no. Extremely, loud, difficult to have a conversation.  We were seated by the door where the helium tank was used to fill dozens and dozens of balloons - the insentient hissing noise was unbearable.   Food was ok.  If you're a rowdy, loud group you would be comfortable there.  If you want to have a quiet conversation, not so much.

I've been to this particular Red Robin quite often. Often they get my order wrong but the staff is nice. I get the same thing I've always gotten for the last three years of going here. It's just a whiskey river bbq burger, no pink. You'd think, something so simple, would be hard to get wrong. 90% of them time it's very pink. Then when I say hey it's pink they just bring me back a burned burger. Also they have a manager whom is balding and he's not very nice.  I still go back to get the same thing because I like the burger. And because I have no self respect.

Food and service are pretty BAD! I told them I'm allergic to lettuce but then i found pieces of lettuce in my burger! They forgot to put cheese on my burger so they brought it in separate plate!!!!  Also we didn't get any of the endless fries.
Great food and get service!! I was pleased with the service and the food. We didn't have to wait long at all. Everyone is so friendly.

Came to Red Robin for our usual Sunday night family dinner. Parking wasn't too bad however we did have to wait about 15-20 min to be seated because they happened to be busy that night. I enjoy this particular location though because you can enjoy some shopping before you eat or after you eat. I have been coming here for years and although I usually only get the chicken tenders and fries, Red Robin definitely has the best chicken tenders and fries I have ever tasted. The staff is always fast and friendly. Of course I will be coming back (:

I used to totally love their Peppercorn burger until yesterday. Changes have been made and I never tasted any pepper, unlike the older version. My burger was also half the size of the other version and it was very greasy. I only got about 10 small fries. Definitely not a good value and Burger King blows Red Robin away. Service was great though. My husband and I will not be going back.
They have bendy straws.... our waitress was amazing as always but bendy straws mN super high class. Did I mention bendy straws.

I ate here this past weekend and it was satisfactory. The host seemed a bit overwhelmed with the couple parties coming in. She was also very quick with us when she sat us at our table and I had no idea what she even said she spoke so fast. Our waitress was pretty good overall, sometimes she was slow getting things out but overall she was fine. The food was satisfactory, just totally average. Something that I didn't enjoy was that I asked for a side salad instead of fries with my meal and they substituted it no problem, but the lettuce seemed pretty cheap and already wilted. It seemed to come straight from a bagged mix. Also, I said some pink on my burger but that I wanted it medium. And it came back pretty pink, some parts I was kind of afraid to eat so I avoided them. All in all I wanted something different so I came here but I can see the reasons behind the average reviews.
This is a great place to grab a quick and tasty bite while shopping. It also relatively affordable. It's not a five star restaurant but it gets the job done.

Red Robin is definitely yum, my friend had a coupon for burgers fries and a salad. The sombrero salad was excellent. It tasted so good. The chicken was not dry and tasted so moist. We split a burger which tasted okay. The fries where endless and satisfying. The best part of my experience was Melanie. She was a great sever and definitely makes me want to come back :) Thank you Melanie for such a positive experience for my first time at Red Robin :)

I usually always have such a great experience at Red Robin, but that's commonly due to the La Jolla UTC location. My fiancé and I decided to drop by this location in North County mall because we knew it was happy hour and we usually get the half off wings & nachos. We entered the restaurant and waited to be seated. After 15 minutes we were still waiting. We looked around and there was no one around to seat us and the restaurant barely had anyone in there (took pictures to exemplify the emptiness of the place). Another 5 minutes passed by and we walked over to the other side and found someone and asked if they could seat us. She asked if we were over the age of 21 cause she was seating us at the bar area ... ok no problem, we just wanted some wings anyway. Got to our seats and waited some more. The waitress finally came up to us and asked what we wanted to drink, she then said she would be right back. We then continued waiting some more ..... 10 minutes went by (and I only know this because I was on my phone playing a timed game) and a guy came up to us who looked like he was still on break. He didn't even have his apron on but he was nice enough to take our orders. His name was Drew and Drew was the only thing keeping us sane. I'm also pretty sure he wasn't even our server because he worked at the bar. Anyway, our waitress came back and apologized but we informed her we ordered already.  Im not sure if they were short staffed but the service (other than Drew) was the worst I have ever had in any restaurant. I looked around and took some pics of the multiple tables that were dirty and remained untouched for quite some time. I'd say 3/4 of our time spent there and DID we spend some time there. Saw a waitress near the bar just on her phone and I usually don't care what they choose to do during work hours but that place was way too busted to just be on your phone texting this whole time.  Moving on the food! I love Red Robin's wings. But the wings we got were not as crispy as they usually are but that's not a completely big deal breaker to me. (It was the service). We also ordered the trio dessert (cronuts, chocolate covered brownie sticks and Oreo ice cream sundae) which was amazing! Overall, today's visit was terrible. The service was terrible, food was OK and our waitress was ghost. Drew, you were awesome! Only upside to the visit actually was your hospitality cause I got the vibe that you knew your restaurant needed some saving at that moment in time.

There's usually a wait, but it's nice that it's in the mall because we just walk around until they text us to let us know our table is ready. Yummy food. There are some great servers and some not so great ones, just depends on who you get.

My cousin & I went here a few days ago. We ended up not even eating there. We stood at the front for about 5-10 minutes waiting to be greeted and seated by an employee. Nobody ever came up to us and the employees saw us standing there. It wasn't even busy when we went so I don't understand why we couldn't be seated.

Great food! Server was extremely rude!! Her name was Kylie. Apparently your child can push to play games on the iPad thing without any approval from you!!! And don't be surprised when you have an extra charge on your bill! When I explained to the waitress that I thought he was playing sample games like they have at Buffalo Wild Wings she just looked at us. She said "Nope. Is there anything else I can help you with?" Barely waited for an answer and turned and walked away. When it came to paying our bill she also didn't really give us the option to pay with her. I get that most people like the iPads, but my mom did not feel comfortable with it but now felt stupid to try any other way. At most places we go the waitress gives us the option to take care of our bill for us or would we like to use the iPad. Too bad the customer service was terrible, the food was so good we might have returned.

I've grown up eating here and it's one of my favorite places to eat if I'm looking for nothing out of this world but a good meal. The fries are great with the seasoning and I can literally eat them forever which is good because they are bottomless. The burgers here aren't half bad either.

At the north county Westfield mall. Parking is shared with other business. Plenty of space and the parking spots are good size. Driveways into the mall are low car friendly and easy to get in and out of There is an entrance to the restaurant from parking lot and from inside the mall.  The burgers are good here. They had a deal for a burger meal for 6.99 which we got. We ordered the Sir Acha Tavern Double and the Madlove. Both were juicy and they asked how we want the meat cooked. We had the steak fries and salad. Both were unlimited. We also ordered a root beer float which had free refills. The server we had was great. She kept on top of things, we always had our drinks refilled and our sides filled. Great customer service and good burgers.  Whenever we are in the area and have a craving for burgers we give this place a top consideration. We would recommend this place to our family and friends.

My favorite burgers and fries. I rarely ever eat beef but when I do it's always here, the burgers are amazing and I'm a HUGE fan of the bottomless garlic fries. I always come here when I want to treat myself or when my boyfriend wants to take me on a date.

Worst service ever.  Came in this evening and wait 1.5 hours for a table.  Ignored us once seated, I had to stage an intervention to get fries.  Forget bottomless fries...  they never came back.  Receipt wouldn't print from this weird kiosk on the table.  Worthless.  Never coming back.

well  we checked in at 1:20 and they told us 30 minutes.  it is 2:10 now , empty dirty tables everywhere .. no manager in sight. if i managed this place, i would be busting my behind making sure people got sat down and fed in a timely manner.  i bet the 30 minutes stretches way past an hour.  I wish i had gone somewhere else.

Ate here yesterday night. Took us over 2 hours to get out of there because our server kept disappearing.  My biggest dissapointment was the fact that I asked for a med rare burger and it came back welldone. I just wanted to get the hell out of there already so I didnt bother even trying to find my server, knowing I'd be waiting another hour. This isnt the first time this has happened at red robin and honestly I dont know why I keep going back hoping their quality will improve but it never does, in every location too. The plaza bonita one is just as terrible.
Service was very slow. Dishes and cutlery were dirty: they had dried on food. Burger had gristle in it. Lettuce was wilted. Forget it. Next time I'm going to Burger Bench.
Terrible service table was not wiped down won't be coming back here again.  The $5.50 house Margarita was of ice.  Super disappointed

I actually LOVE Red Robin.  Why do I love a chain restaurant?  Its simple.  That Royal Red Burger is DELICIOUS and I really love their fries.  They are thick cut like mom used to make.  The bottomless part doesn't hurt of course. They've remodeled this location and added a bar area, which is nice because you can skip waiting up front with the throngs of children and head straight to the bar for quick eating.  This has become how we eat at Red Robin! The last couple times we sat at the bar and the bartender served us.  She is great.  It was the same person twice and she's fast and friendly.  The bigger problem is she isn't the one running the food from the kitchen to the table and those people are POKEY.  The burgers coming out takes a while usually and while there are bottomless fries, they give you a 4 year old's handful of fries to start you.  Let me help you out.  ASK FOR MORE AS SOON AS THEY DROP YOUR PLATE OFF!  You'll thank me later.  Even though, you will be lucky if that runner remembers to bring those fries or if you have to appeal to the bartender after you finish your burgers and no one ever returned.  Now, normally I'm pretty flexible but the same thing happened TWICE, so I did include a comment about it on the payment machine when I was done.  I love sitting at the bar, but I don't want to be forgotten! But OTHER than that, I really like Red Robin.  They are usually fairly quick, the staff is generally friendly, and I like all of the food I've had there from fish & chips to burgers to sandwiches, to salads.  GOOD STUFF.

I have personally always enjoyed the food but the service at this location the past couple visits has been horrible! The last time my family and I visited Red Robin in the mall we waited over 45 minutes for our food. I asked the server what was taking do long? She brought back our food 2 minutes later frozen cold. All the plates were sitting there for at least 20 minutes. Our family ended up just leaving.  Today we decided to give Red Robin in the mall a second chance. We had a long day of visiting Santa and shopping for the holidays. The family was hungry and decided to grab a bite to eat. When we got to the front area to reserve a table the staff took our name down for a party of 5. We waited for half hour with 3 young children. We noticed that all the people in front of us were seated, thinking that we would be coming up next. That did not happen. They called the group of people that came after us. We sat and waited until we saw another big group get called up. At this time I approached the hostess and asked why we have not been called. The young girl said she apologizes and that she accidently skipped our group. We proceeded to wait another 20 minutes and then turned around and left.  Our family will not stop going to Red Robin but for sure will never visit this location again. Very pour service! I would not recommend this location to anyone.

I've come to this location and gotten great service (large party- very attentive to us), I've come to this location and gotten mediocre service and I've come nights like tonight when its far to busy to get good service. Seriously every table was sat and our server could not handle her  tables. We would have to ask for something and by the time it took to deliver a refill or whatever,  2 more at our table were out drinks.  I even got am attitude response from our server tonight which stated "oh you guys need something else?" You should of heard her tone. She was clearly overwhelmed! I think Red robin should have a hostess or something going around and doing drink refills or  bottomless fry basket runs to help out the servers during a rush like this. Especially since they give you such a small amount of fries in the basket to share so the server is running back and forth.  The food is amazing but the restaurant should do some changes to help their customers. One thing I did love is that I got to walk the mall during my wait and they text us when our table was ready.  Also,  sign up for royalty rewards and you get a free burger on your birthday!

My boyfriend and I have come here twice in the last three months and this place is awesome! Our waitress, which we personally requested in our most recent visit, Kit (the gal with the dreads) is awesome! She is personable, hard working and fast with the orders and she even remembered us when we came back. She is just the right amount of fun and business. The Caesar Salad Wrap is the bomb! Despite the most recent visit having a small lack of romaine lettuce, Kit was quick on the draw for a substitute lettuce! My boyfriend's burger was awesome as well and the chili cheese fries appetizer was great~ Highly recommend this spot for either a quick fix, or a nice family meal. And definitely recommend Kit because she is awesome!
